original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how is it that you are not afraid of the lower realms?🔽🔽

original: de bzhin gshegs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know afflictions exactly as they are?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod chags kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /🔽'dod chags dang zhe sdang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod chags kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata knows desire-based afflictions exactly as they are.🔽He knows desire- and anger-based afflictions exactly as they are.

original: 'dod chags dang gti mug gis @146a *//🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /🔽zhe sdang dang 'dod chags kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang gti mug gis @146a *// kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen / zhe sdang dang 'dod chags kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows desire- and delusion-based afflictions exactly as they are.🔽He knows anger- and desire-based afflictions exactly as they are.🔽He knows anger- and delusion-based afflictions exactly as they are.

original: zhe sdang dang gti mug gis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang gti mug gis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows delusion- and desire-based afflictions exactly as they are.🔽He knows delusion- and anger-based afflictions exactly as they are.

original: gti mug dang 'dod chags kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: gti mug dang 'dod chags kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows perfectly the afflictions of delusion and desire.

original: cha mnyam par kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: cha mnyam par kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows perfectly the afflictions of equal proportions.

original: khro bas kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: khro bas kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows perfectly the afflictions of anger.

original: 'khor dang / yongs su gdung ba dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / g-yo dang / sgyu dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / khengs pa dang / nyes rtsom dang / rgyags pa dang / bag med pa dang /🔽nga rgyal las kyang lhag pa'i nga rgyal gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: 'khor dang / yongs su gdung ba dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / g-yo dang / sgyu dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / khengs pa dang / nyes rtsom dang / rgyags pa dang / bag med pa dang / nga rgyal las kyang lhag pa'i nga rgyal gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows perfectly the afflictions of jealousy, miserliness, deceit, fraud, shamelessness, lack of embarrassment, arrogance, malice, intoxication, and heedlessness.🔽He knows perfectly the afflictions of pride and the pride of thinking ‘I am.’

original: nga rgyal gyi'ang nga rgyal gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi'ang nga rgyal gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows perfectly the afflictions of the pride of thinking ‘I am’ and the pride of thinking ‘I am supreme.’

original: log pa'i nga rgyal gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: log pa'i nga rgyal gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows perfectly the defilement by false pride and the defilement by manifest pride.

original: lhag pa'i nga @146b rgyal gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: lhag pa'i nga @146b rgyal gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows perfectly the defilement by excessive pride.

original: cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows perfectly the defilement by the pride of thinking ‘I am,’

original: kha gsag dang / gzhogs slong dang / thob kyis 'jal bas kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: kha gsag dang / gzhogs slong dang / thob kyis 'jal bas kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows perfectly the defilement by flattery, hinting, and seeking gain through gain.

original: rnyed pas rnyed par byed 'dod pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / sdig 'dod pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / 'dod chen dang / 'dod pa dang / dran pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / spyod pa ma yin pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: rnyed pas rnyed par byed 'dod pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / sdig 'dod pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / 'dod chen dang / 'dod pa dang / dran pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / spyod pa ma yin pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: He knows perfectly the defilement by the desire for gain through gain, the defilement by the desire for evil, the defilement by great desire, the defilement by desire, the defilement by memory, and the defilement by improper action.

original: mi snyan par smra ba nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / mi bzod pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / sbed pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / yongs su sbed pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / chos ma yin pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: mi snyan par smra ba nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / mi bzod pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / sbed pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / yongs su sbed pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / chos ma yin pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: It is afflicted by speaking unpleasantly, by intolerance, by concealment, by complete concealment, by attachment to non-Dharma,

original: chags pa dang mi mthun par chags pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta bas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / the tshom gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: chags pa dang mi mthun par chags pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta bas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / the tshom gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: by attachment to what is contrary to attachment, by the afflicted view of the transitory collection, by doubt, by holding discipline and rituals as paramount,

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gnod sems kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa @147a *//
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gnod sems kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa @147a *//
translated: by desire for sense objects, by malice,🔽by

original: dang / rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / yid gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / mi dga' bas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / dga' bas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: dang / rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / yid gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / mi dga' bas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / dga' bas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: It is afflicted by drowsiness and torpor, afflicted by agitation and remorse, afflicted by doubt, afflicted by unhappiness, afflicted by happiness,

original: glal bas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / bza' ba ma bsdams pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / sems las byung ba kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / sems kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / 'du shes nas tshogs kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: glal bas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / bza' ba ma bsdams pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / sems las byung ba kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / sems kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / 'du shes nas tshogs kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: afflicted by yawning, afflicted by lack of restraint in eating, afflicted by mental factors, afflicted by the mind, afflicted by the assembly of perceptions,

original: bdag la dbang med pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / lus kyi gnas ngan len gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / thogs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / chog mi shes pas kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag la dbang med pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / lus kyi gnas ngan len gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / thogs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / chog mi shes pas kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: afflicted by lack of control over oneself, afflicted by physical dysfunction, afflicted by obstruction, and afflicted by lack of contentment.

original: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: Householder, in that way,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata fully knows, just as it is, the knowledge of the afflictions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to ask him about that knowledge of the afflictions of the Tathāgata, he would answer for an eon, or what is left over from an eon.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: The origin, the cessation, and the path should be understood as they were explained above.

original: de bzhin gshegs @147b pas rnam par byang ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /🔽khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i gnyen po ni /🔽mi gtsang ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @147b pas rnam par byang ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na / khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i gnyen po ni / mi gtsang ba'o //
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata fully know, just as it is, the knowledge of purification?

original: zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /🔽gnod sems kyi gnyen po ni /
analyzed: zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen / gnod sems kyi gnyen po ni /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata fully knows, just as it is, that the antidote to the desire for sensual pleasure is impurity.

original: byams pa'o // zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: byams pa'o // zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He fully knows, just as it is, that the antidote to malice is loving kindness.🔽He fully knows, just as it is, that the antidote to the afflictions of the mind is the meditation on the inconstancy of things.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par byang ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to ask the Tathāgata about this knowledge of complete purification, he would answer for an eon or more.

translated: The origin, cessation, and path are as previously explained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par gzhag pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par gzhag pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the knowledge of presentation?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, in this case, the Tathāgata knows thus:

original: 'di ltar bsam gtan dang po las ldang bar bya zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam gtan dang po las ldang bar bya zhing /
translated: ‘I will arise from the first concentration

original: bsam gtan dang po las langs nas chos 'di dag la yang dag par spyod pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po las langs nas chos 'di dag la yang dag par spyod pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: “Having arisen from the first concentration, he knows perfectly the phenomena that are being practiced.

original: bsam gtan dang po las langs pa'i sems dben pa la gzhol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po las langs pa'i sems dben pa la gzhol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows perfectly the mind that has arisen from the first concentration and is directed toward solitude.

original: bsam gtan dang po las langs pa'i sems dga' bar byed pa'i chos gang yin pa dang / bsam gtan dang po las langs pa'i mngon par rjod par byed pa'i chos gang yin pa dang / de dang po'i chos gang yin pa yang dag par spyod pa'i chos de dag rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po las langs pa'i sems dga' bar byed pa'i chos gang yin pa dang / bsam gtan dang po las langs pa'i mngon par rjod par byed pa'i chos gang yin pa dang / de dang po'i chos gang yin pa yang dag par spyod pa'i chos de dag rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows perfectly the phenomena that cause the mind to be joyful when it has arisen from the first concentration, the phenomena that cause it to express itself, and the phenomena that cause it to practice the Dharma of the first concentration.

original: sems gang gzhol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: sems gang gzhol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows perfectly the mind that is directed.

original: chos gang dag la dga' ba'i chos de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: chos gang dag la dga' ba'i chos de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows perfectly the phenomena that cause the mind to be joyful.

original: gang dag la mi dga' ba'i chos de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: gang dag la mi dga' ba'i chos de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows well the phenomena that are not liked.🔽He knows well the phenomena that are liked.🔽He knows well the phenomena that are neither liked nor not liked.🔽He knows well the phenomena that are liked and not liked.🔽He knows well the phenomena that are neither liked nor not liked.

original: chos gang yid la byas shing ldang ba de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /🔽de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / @149a *//
analyzed: chos gang yid la byas shing ldang ba de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te / de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / @149a *//
translated: He knows well the phenomena that are liked and not liked.🔽He knows well the phenomena that are neither liked nor not liked.🔽He knows well the phenomena that are liked and not liked.

original: de bzhin du rnam par thar pa rnams dang / de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / de bzhin du snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par thar pa rnams dang / de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / de bzhin du snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi ste /

original: longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: He knows well the phenomena that are liked and not liked.🔽He knows well the phenomena that are neither liked nor not liked.🔽He knows well the phenomena that are liked and not liked.🔽He knows well the phenomena

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path, just as they have been taught.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how is it that

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sngon gyi mtha' shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sngon gyi mtha' shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: the Tathāgata knows the knowledge of the past in accordance with reality?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sngon gyi bskal pa rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sngon gyi bskal pa rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, in this regard, the Tathāgata knows the past eons.

original: bskal pa gang du ming du btags par gyur pa de /
analyzed: bskal pa gang du ming du btags par gyur pa de /
translated: In which eon was a name designated?

original: rkyen gang dag gis ming du btags nas yang dag par gnas pa'i bskal pa de dag ni /
analyzed: rkyen gang dag gis ming du btags nas yang dag par gnas pa'i bskal pa de dag ni /
translated: By what conditions was a name designated and correctly established?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Those eons are as follows:

original: dper na / bskal pa bzang po 'di'i ming bskal pa padma stong mthong zhes btags pa de bzhin du bskal pa de dag gi so so rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: dper na / bskal pa bzang po 'di'i ming bskal pa padma stong mthong zhes btags pa de bzhin du bskal pa de dag gi so so rab tu mkhyen /
translated: For example, just as the name of this Bhadra kalpa was designated as Padmasahasranetra kalpa, he knows each of those eons in that way.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi mtshan btsun par btags pa'ang rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi mtshan btsun par btags pa'ang rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He also knows the names of those Bhagavān Buddhas that were designated as venerable.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dper na / 'dir sh'akya'i rigs @149b las thub pa 'khrungs pa la sh'akya thub pa zhes mtshan btags pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na / 'dir sh'akya'i rigs @149b las thub pa 'khrungs pa la sh'akya thub pa zhes mtshan btags pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the Sage who was born in the Śākya clan is called Śākyamuni.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bskal pa de dag dang / sangs rgyas de dag gi mtshan btags pa rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bskal pa de dag dang / sangs rgyas de dag gi mtshan btags pa rab tu mkhyen /
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata knows the names of those eons and of those Buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas der yang sems can thams cad kyi ming du btags pa rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas der yang sems can thams cad kyi ming du btags pa rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata also knows the names of all the sentient beings there.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sngon gyi mtha' shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sngon gyi mtha' shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If someone were to ask the Tathāgata about his knowledge of past lives, he could answer for an eon, or even longer than an eon.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: The same is true for his knowledge of the arising of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sngon gyi gnas shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sngon gyi gnas shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the knowledge of past lives correctly and in detail?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata knows the past of beings,

original: gang du bdag yun ring por gnas shing /
analyzed: gang du bdag yun ring por gnas shing /
translated: where he has lived for a long time,

original: de nas kyang sngon gyi gnas gang la phyir zhing gnas pa /
analyzed: de nas kyang sngon gyi gnas gang la phyir zhing gnas pa /
translated: and where he will live again in the future.

original: gal te sems can dmyal ba'am /
analyzed: gal te sems can dmyal ba'am /
translated: If it is in the hells,

original: gal te dud 'gro'i skye gnas su'am /
analyzed: gal te dud 'gro'i skye gnas su'am /
translated: if it is in the animal realm,

original: gal te gshin rje'i 'jig rten du'am /
analyzed: gal te gshin rje'i 'jig rten du'am /
translated: if it is in the world of Yama,

original: gal te mir ram /
analyzed: gal te mir ram /
translated: if it is among humans,🔽if it is among the gods,

original: gal te lhar ram; gal te yi dvags su'am /🔽gal te sengger ram /🔽gal te stag tu'am /
analyzed: gal te lhar ram; gal te yi dvags su'am / gal te sengger ram / gal te stag tu'am /
translated: if it is among lions,🔽if it is among tigers,

original: gal te gzig tu'am /
analyzed: gal te gzig tu'am /
translated: if it is among leopards,

original: gal te nam mkha' la rgyu ba'am /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' la rgyu ba'am /
translated: if it is among those who move in the sky,

original: gal te bya'i tshogs su'am /🔽@150a *// gal te sbrul gdug pa'i tshogs su'am /
analyzed: gal te bya'i tshogs su'am / @150a *// gal te sbrul gdug pa'i tshogs su'am /
translated: if it is among flocks of birds,🔽if it is among poisonous snakes,

original: gal te sbrul gyi tshogs su'am /
analyzed: gal te sbrul gyi tshogs su'am /
translated: if it is among snakes,

original: gal te ser mo'i tshogs su'am /
analyzed: gal te ser mo'i tshogs su'am /
translated: if it is among jackals,

original: gal te sa la rgyu bar ram; gal te bar snang la rgyu bar ram /
analyzed: gal te sa la rgyu bar ram; gal te bar snang la rgyu bar ram /
translated: if it is among those who move on the earth, if it is among those who move in the sky,

original: gal te rkang med du'am /
analyzed: gal te rkang med du'am /
translated: if it is among those without feet,

original: gal te rkang gnyis par ram /
analyzed: gal te rkang gnyis par ram /
translated: if it is among those with two feet,

original: gal te rkang bzhi par ram /
analyzed: gal te rkang bzhi par ram /
translated: or if they are born as quadrupeds,

original: gal te rkang mang du'am /
analyzed: gal te rkang mang du'am /
translated: or if they are born as many-legged creatures,

original: gal te chu la rgyu bar ram /
analyzed: gal te chu la rgyu bar ram /
translated: or if they are born in the water,

original: gal te skam sa la rgyu bar ram /🔽gal te gnod sbyin gyi tshogs su'am /🔽gal te sha za'i tshogs su'am /
analyzed: gal te skam sa la rgyu bar ram / gal te gnod sbyin gyi tshogs su'am / gal te sha za'i tshogs su'am /
translated: or if they are born on dry land,🔽or if they are born in the assembly of yakṣas,🔽or if they are born in the assembly of piśācas,

original: gal te srin po'i tshogs su'am /
analyzed: gal te srin po'i tshogs su'am /
translated: or if they are born in the assembly of rākṣasas,

original: gal te 'byung po'i tshugs su'am /
analyzed: gal te 'byung po'i tshugs su'am /
translated: or if they are born in the assembly of bhūtas,

original: gal te lha ma yin gyi tshogs su'am /🔽gal te nam mkha' lding gi tshogs su'am /
analyzed: gal te lha ma yin gyi tshogs su'am / gal te nam mkha' lding gi tshogs su'am /
translated: or if they are born in the assembly of asuras,🔽or if they are born in the assembly of garuḍas,

original: gal te mi'am ci'i tshogs su'am /
analyzed: gal te mi'am ci'i tshogs su'am /
translated: or if they are born in the assembly of kiṃnaras,

original: gal te lto 'phye chen po'i tshogs su'am /
analyzed: gal te lto 'phye chen po'i tshogs su'am /
translated: or if they are born in the assembly of mahoragas,

original: gal te mi ma yin pa'i tshogs su'am /
analyzed: gal te mi ma yin pa'i tshogs su'am /
translated: or if they are born in the assembly of non-humans,

original: gal te phreng ba 'chang ba'i tshogs su'am /
analyzed: gal te phreng ba 'chang ba'i tshogs su'am /
translated: or if they are born in the assembly of garland-bearers,

original: gal te lag na gzhong thogs kyi lhar ram /
analyzed: gal te lag na gzhong thogs kyi lhar ram /
translated: or if they are born as the gods who hold bowls in their hands,

original: gal te rtag tu myos pa'i lhar ram /
analyzed: gal te rtag tu myos pa'i lhar ram /
translated: or if they are born as the gods who are always intoxicated,

original: gal te lus rgyan thogs pa'i lhar ram /
analyzed: gal te lus rgyan thogs pa'i lhar ram /
translated: or if they are born as the gods who wear ornamented bodies,

original: gal te rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lhar ram /
analyzed: gal te rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lhar ram /
translated: or if they are born as the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm,

original: gal te sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lhar ram /
analyzed: gal te sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lhar ram /
translated: or if they are born as the gods of the Trayas­triṃśa realm,

original: gal te 'thab bral gyi lha nas de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽dga' ldan du'am /
analyzed: gal te 'thab bral gyi lha nas de bzhin du sbyar te / dga' ldan du'am /
translated: If they are born among the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife, and similarly,🔽if they are born in the Heaven of Joy,

original: gal te 'phrul dgar ram /
analyzed: gal te 'phrul dgar ram /
translated: if they are born in the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations,

original: gal te gzhan 'phrul dbang @150b byed dam /🔽gal te tshangs par ram /
analyzed: gal te gzhan 'phrul dbang @150b byed dam / gal te tshangs par ram /
translated: if they are born in the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations,🔽if they are born in the Brahma realm,

original: gal te tshangs ris su'am /
analyzed: gal te tshangs ris su'am /
translated: if they are born in the Brahma Group,

original: gal te tshangs pa mdun na 'don du'am /🔽gal te tshangs pa kun 'khor du'am /
analyzed: gal te tshangs pa mdun na 'don du'am / gal te tshangs pa kun 'khor du'am /
translated: if they are born in the Brahma Ministers,

original: gal te tshangs pa chen por ram /🔽gal te 'od du'am /
analyzed: gal te tshangs pa chen por ram / gal te 'od du'am /
translated: if they are born in the Great Brahma Heaven,🔽if they are born in the Luminous Heaven,

original: gal te 'od chung du'am /🔽gal te tshad med 'od du'am /
analyzed: gal te 'od chung du'am / gal te tshad med 'od du'am /
translated: if they are born in the Heaven of Lesser Luminous Gods,🔽if they are born in the Heaven of Immeasurable Luminous Gods,

original: gal te 'od gsal du'am /
analyzed: gal te 'od gsal du'am /
translated: if they are born in the Heaven of Luminous Gods,🔽if they are born in the Heaven of Perfected Virtue,🔽if they are born in the Heaven of Lesser Perfected Virtue,🔽if they are born in the Heaven of Immeasurable Perfected Virtue,

original: gal te dge bar ram /
analyzed: gal te dge bar ram /
translated: if they are born in the Heaven of Perfected Virtue,🔽if they are born in the Cloudless Heaven,

original: chung dger ram /🔽tshad med dger ram /
analyzed: chung dger ram / tshad med dger ram /
translated: if they are born in the Heaven of Lesser Clouds,🔽if they are born in the Heaven of Immeasurable Clouds,

original: dge rgyas su'am /🔽che bar ram /🔽chung cher ram /
analyzed: dge rgyas su'am / che bar ram / chung cher ram /
translated: if they are born in the Heaven of Increasing Virtue,🔽if they are born in the Heaven of No Hardship,

original: tshad med cer ram /
analyzed: tshad med cer ram /
translated: if they are born in the Heaven of Great Reward,🔽if they are born in the Heaven of the Serene,

original: 'bras bu che bar ram /🔽'du shes med pa'i sems can du'am /
analyzed: 'bras bu che bar ram / 'du shes med pa'i sems can du'am /
translated: if they are born in the Heaven of Great Fruition,🔽if they are born in the Heaven of the Highest,🔽if they are born in the Heaven of No Thought,

original: gal te nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du'am /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du'am /
translated: if they are born in the Sphere of Infinite Space,

original: gal te rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched du'am /
analyzed: gal te rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched du'am /
translated: if they are born in the Sphere of Infinite Consciousness,

original: gal te ci'ang med pa'i skye mched du'am /
analyzed: gal te ci'ang med pa'i skye mched du'am /
translated: if they are born in the Sphere of Nothingness,

original: gal te 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du ste /
analyzed: gal te 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du ste /
translated: If it is the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathagata knows it as it really is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'das pa'i dus kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag mngon par 'dus byas pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'das pa'i dus kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag mngon par 'dus byas pa /
translated: The Tathagata knows the roots of virtue that have been accumulated in the past,

original: gal te sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang so so yang dag par ldan pa'am /
analyzed: gal te sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang so so yang dag par ldan pa'am /
translated: if they are associated with the perfection of generosity,

original: gal te tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang so so yang dag par ldan pa'am /🔽gal te bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang so so yang dag par ldan pa'am /
analyzed: gal te tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang so so yang dag par ldan pa'am / gal te bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang so so yang dag par ldan pa'am /
translated: if they are associated with the perfection of morality,🔽if they are associated with the perfection of patience,

original: gal te brtson 'grus kyi pha @151a *//🔽rol tu phyin pa dang so so yang dag par ldan pa'am /
analyzed: gal te brtson 'grus kyi pha @151a *// rol tu phyin pa dang so so yang dag par ldan pa'am /
translated: if they are associated with the perfection of diligence,🔽if they are associated with the perfection of concentration,

original: gal te bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang so so yang dag par ldan pa'am /
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang so so yang dag par ldan pa'am /
translated: if they are associated with the perfection of wisdom,

original: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang so so yang dag par ldan pa de dag thams cad rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang so so yang dag par ldan pa de dag thams cad rab tu mkhyen /
translated: “He knows all the perfections of wisdom and the various kinds of right understanding.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'das pa'i dus su 'khor ba gang dag la gnas nas gang du sangs rgyas bcos ldan 'das des par gnas pa de dag la bsnyen bkur byas shing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'das pa'i dus su 'khor ba gang dag la gnas nas gang du sangs rgyas bcos ldan 'das des par gnas pa de dag la bsnyen bkur byas shing /
translated: “He knows all the practices that the Tathāgata previously accomplished while he was in cyclic existence, while he was abiding in the various states of existence, while he was serving the buddhas, the blessed ones, and asking them questions.

original: yongs su zhus nas mkhyen pa gang dag bsgrubs pa 'di lta ste; thabs la mkhas pa dang / bzo'i shes pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa shes pa bsgrubs pa de dang / de dag thams cad rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: yongs su zhus nas mkhyen pa gang dag bsgrubs pa 'di lta ste; thabs la mkhas pa dang / bzo'i shes pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa shes pa bsgrubs pa de dang / de dag thams cad rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows all the practices that he accomplished, such as skill in means, knowledge of the arts, and knowledge of samādhi.

original: zag pa zad pa shes pa ma gtogs par bzo'am /🔽bzo shes pa'am /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa shes pa ma gtogs par bzo'am / bzo shes pa'am /
translated: “There is no art, no knowledge of an art,

original: las sam / las shes pa gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas sngon ma bskyed pa med de /
analyzed: las sam / las shes pa gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas sngon ma bskyed pa med de /
translated: no action, and no knowledge of an action that the Tathāgata has not previously generated.

original: sngon mngon par 'dus ma byas pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: sngon mngon par 'dus ma byas pa gang yang med do //
translated: There is nothing that he has not previously accomplished.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: “Therefore,

original: 'dir gang gi ye shes mthong ba thogs pa med par 'jug pa de ni /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi ye shes mthong ba thogs pa med par 'jug pa de ni /
translated: Here, whoever’s wisdom is unobstructed in seeing

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: will enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the fine mansion.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The origin, cessation, and path are as taught.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how is it that

original: de bzhin gshegs @151b pas phyi ma'i mtha' shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @151b pas phyi ma'i mtha' shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: the Tathāgata knows the future as it truly is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / sems can rnams kyi ming du btags pa rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / sems can rnams kyi ming du btags pa rab tu mkhyen /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows the names of the buddhas and sentient beings of future eons.

original: rgyu gang dang rkyen gang dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / sems can de rnams kyi ming du btags par 'gyur ba de thams cad de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rgyu gang dang rkyen gang dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / sems can de rnams kyi ming du btags par 'gyur ba de thams cad de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows all the causes and conditions by which the names of those buddha bhagavāns and sentient beings will come to be.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa phyi ma'i mtha' shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa phyi ma'i mtha' shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If someone were to ask the Tathāgata about the knowledge of the future, he would answer for an eon, or he would answer for even longer than an eon.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: The same goes for the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'chi ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'chi ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the knowledge of death and rebirth?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows thus:

original: sems can gang dag skyes nas 'chi bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: sems can gang dag skyes nas 'chi bar 'gyur ba /
translated: “There are sentient beings who, after being born, die.

original: 'chi ba dang / 'chi 'pho dang / 'chi bar byed pa dang / gsod pa dang / dus byed pa dang / phung po 'jig pa dang / lus 'dor ba dang / srog gi dbang po yang dag par gcod pa dang // ris lhan cig mthun pa byed pa /
analyzed: 'chi ba dang / 'chi 'pho dang / 'chi bar byed pa dang / gsod pa dang / dus byed pa dang / phung po 'jig pa dang / lus 'dor ba dang / srog gi dbang po yang dag par gcod pa dang // ris lhan cig mthun pa byed pa /
translated: They die, pass away, perish, cease, and disappear. They give up their bodies, and their life faculties are cut off. They are separated from their companions, and their sense bases disintegrate.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba @152a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba @152a *//
translated: The Tathāgata has taught the truth just as it is.🔽

original: bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: The Tathāgata has perfect knowledge of death as it really is.

original: sems can 'di dag ni tshe'i tshad yongs su ma rdzogs par 'chi bar 'gyur /🔽sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni tshe'i tshad yongs su ma rdzogs par 'chi bar 'gyur / sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: These sentient beings die before their lifespan is exhausted.

original: pha rol gyi gnod pas 'chi bar 'gyur /
analyzed: pha rol gyi gnod pas 'chi bar 'gyur /
translated: These sentient beings die through the harm of others.

original: sems can 'di dag ni /🔽yang dag par spangs pas 'chi bar 'gyur /🔽sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni / yang dag par spangs pas 'chi bar 'gyur / sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: These sentient beings die through their own harm.🔽These sentient beings die through the harm of both.

original: yang ba ma spangs pas 'chi bar 'gyur /🔽sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: yang ba ma spangs pas 'chi bar 'gyur / sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: These sentient beings die through the harm of neither.🔽These sentient beings die through the exhaustion of merit.🔽These sentient beings die through the exhaustion of life.🔽These sentient beings die through the exhaustion of food.🔽These sentient beings die through the exhaustion of merit and life.🔽These sentient beings die through the exhaustion of merit and food.

original: dus tshigs kyis bsgyur nas 'chi bar 'gyur /🔽sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: dus tshigs kyis bsgyur nas 'chi bar 'gyur / sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: These sentient beings die through the exhaustion of life and food.

original: bsod nams zad pas 'chi bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bsod nams zad pas 'chi bar 'gyur /
translated: These sentient beings die through the exhaustion of merit, life, and food.

original: zhes de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas 'chi ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: zhes de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas 'chi ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata has perfect knowledge of death as it really is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'chi ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'chi ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to ask the Tathāgata about this knowledge of death, he could answer for an eon or more.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path, just as they are.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas skye ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas skye ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata, Worthy, Perfectly Complete Buddha know the knowledge of the arising of beings?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows thus:

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: ‘When a son of good lineage or

original: rigs kyi bu mo 'chi ba na skye ba'i mtshan ma 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo 'chi ba na skye ba'i mtshan ma 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: a daughter of good lineage dies, these signs of rebirth appear.

original: gang dus 'dis skye bar byed pa sems can dmyal ba'i mtshan ma dag mthong ba ni /
analyzed: gang dus 'dis skye bar byed pa sems can dmyal ba'i mtshan ma dag mthong ba ni /
translated: If they see signs of hell beings,

original: sems can dmyal bar 'gro'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal bar 'gro'o //
translated: they will go to the hells.

original: @152b dud 'gro'i mtshan ma dag mthong ba ni /
analyzed: @152b dud 'gro'i mtshan ma dag mthong ba ni /
translated: If they see signs of animals,

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su 'gro'o //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su 'gro'o //
translated: they will go to the animal world.

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi mtshan ma dag mthong ba ni /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi mtshan ma dag mthong ba ni /
translated: If they see signs of the world of Yama,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du 'gro'o //
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du 'gro'o //
translated: they will go to the world of Yama.

original: mi'i mtshan ma dag mthong ba ni /
analyzed: mi'i mtshan ma dag mthong ba ni /
translated: If they see signs of humans,

original: mi'i 'jig rten du 'gro'o //
analyzed: mi'i 'jig rten du 'gro'o //
translated: they will go to the human world.

original: lha'i mtshan ma dag mthong ba ni /
analyzed: lha'i mtshan ma dag mthong ba ni /
translated: Seeing the signs of the gods,

original: mtho ris su 'gro'o //
analyzed: mtho ris su 'gro'o //
translated: one goes to the higher realms.

original: mir skye ba'i mtshan ma dag mthong ba ni /
analyzed: mir skye ba'i mtshan ma dag mthong ba ni /
translated: Seeing the signs of birth as a human,

original: mya ngan las 'das par 'gro'o zhes /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par 'gro'o zhes /
translated: one goes to nirvāṇa.”

original: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: Householder, in this way

original: de bzhin gshegs pas skye ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas skye ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata knows the knowledge of birth exactly as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de ni /
translated: If one were to ask the Tathāgata about this knowledge of birth, he would answer for an eon, or even longer than an eon.

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He would enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and palace.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The origin, the cessation, and the path are as has been taught.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod pa'i zag pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na; khyim bdag /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod pa'i zag pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na; khyim bdag /
translated: does the Tathāgata know the defilement of desire exactly as it is? Householder,

original: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: in this regard the Tathāgata knows thus:

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa ni /
translated: The defilement of desire

original: yongs su rtog pa las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba /
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba /
translated: It is devoid of an essence that arises from conceptualization.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa /
translated: It is not real.

original: so so nye bar gzhog pa /
analyzed: so so nye bar gzhog pa /
translated: It is a false imputation.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'jig par byed pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'jig par byed pa /
translated: It destroys the roots of virtue.

original: bcings pa lhod kyang rab tu thar par dka' ba /🔽mi bshes kyang bshes @153a *//
analyzed: bcings pa lhod kyang rab tu thar par dka' ba / mi bshes kyang bshes @153a *//
translated: Even if it is loosened, it is difficult to be liberated.

original: pa ltar snang ba /
analyzed: pa ltar snang ba /
translated: It appears as a friend, but is not a friend.

original: bar du gcod par byed pa /
analyzed: bar du gcod par byed pa /
translated: It creates obstacles.

original: mi mthun pa rnam pa du ma dag tu mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa rnam pa du ma dag tu mtshungs pa'o //
translated: It is similar to the many kinds of discord.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: “The knowledge, seeing, clarity, realization, full understanding, and expertise regarding this are

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: called ‘the knowledge of the defilement of desire.’

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: It is known as it truly is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'dod pa'i zag pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'dod pa'i zag pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to ask the Tathāgata about the knowledge of the defilement of desire, he could answer for an eon or more.”

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: the origin, the cessation, and the path are just as they have been described.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas srid pa'i zag pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas srid pa'i zag pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the defilement of existence as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows thus:

original: srid pa la sred pa dang / srid pa la rtag tu mngon par dga' ba dang / srid pa'i bya ba la chags pa dang / srid pa la ro myang bar bltas pa dang / srid pa gang gi dbang gis sngon gyi mtha' ma shes te /
analyzed: srid pa la sred pa dang / srid pa la rtag tu mngon par dga' ba dang / srid pa'i bya ba la chags pa dang / srid pa la ro myang bar bltas pa dang / srid pa gang gi dbang gis sngon gyi mtha' ma shes te /
translated: “Craving for existence, always delighting in existence, attachment to the activities of existence, looking for the taste of existence, and the existence by the power of which the prior limit is not known

original: sdug bsngal nyams su myong la srid pa de'i sdug bsngal la chags shing rab tu mi shes /
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyams su myong la srid pa de'i sdug bsngal la chags shing rab tu mi shes /
translated: — experiencing suffering, attached to the suffering of that existence, not knowing it well,

original: sdug bsngal spang ba rab tu mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal spang ba rab tu mi shes pa'o //
translated: not knowing well the abandonment of suffering.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang @153b yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang @153b yin pa 'di ni /
translated: “That which is knowledge, seeing, up to skill regarding that is

original: srid pa'i zag pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i zag pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: called ‘the knowledge of the defilement of existence.’

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully known the truth about that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa srid pa'i zag pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa srid pa'i zag pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you ask in what way the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the defilement of existence is unobstructed and unimpeded,

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: the arising, cessation, enjoyment, and path are as already described.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas lta ba'i zag pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas lta ba'i zag pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the defilement of views as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /🔽lam gol bar zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te / lam gol bar zhugs pa ni /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows as follows:

original: 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag yin te /
translated: ‘These are the wrong paths.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: chad par lta ba dang / rtag par lta ba'o //
analyzed: chad par lta ba dang / rtag par lta ba'o //
translated: the view of annihilation and the view of permanence.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gang chad pa'i chos de gang yang med cing /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / gang chad pa'i chos de gang yang med cing /
translated: Why is that?🔽There is no phenomenon whatsoever that is annihilated.

original: gang 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol tu 'pho ba'i chos de'ang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol tu 'pho ba'i chos de'ang mi dmigs te /
translated: Nor is there a phenomenon that passes from this world to the next.

original: gzhan du na las tshogs pa dag gis skye ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na las tshogs pa dag gis skye ste /
translated: Otherwise, it would arise from the convergence of actions.

original: khyim bdag / 'di lta ste; dper na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di lta ste; dper na /
translated: Householder, it is like this:

original: chu chen po 'bab pa na sgra 'byung la /
analyzed: chu chen po 'bab pa na sgra 'byung la /
translated: When a great river flows, a sound arises.

original: de'i sgra 'byung ba la byed pa po su'ang med de /
analyzed: de'i sgra 'byung ba la byed pa po su'ang med de /
translated: But that sound does not have any agent.

original: gzhan du na tshogs pa'i sbyor bas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan du na tshogs pa'i sbyor bas 'byung ngo //
translated: Otherwise, it arises from the convergence of conditions.

original: khyim bdag / de bzhin du rkyen yod na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de bzhin du rkyen yod na /
translated: Householder, in the same way, when conditions exist,

original: 'khor ba'i rgyun du 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyun du 'jug ste /
translated: the stream of saṃsāra enters.

original: nyon mongs pa dag yod na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dag yod na /
translated: When afflictions exist,

original: las byed la /
analyzed: las byed la /
translated: actions are performed.

original: las yod na /
analyzed: las yod na /
translated: When actions exist,

original: rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub cing 'dir so so myong bar @154a *//
analyzed: rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub cing 'dir so so myong bar @154a *//
translated: the ripening of results is established, and here the experience of each one is established.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa gang yang med de /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa gang yang med de /
translated: But there is no one at all who creates it.

original: gzhan du na rkyen de dag yod cing tshogs pas 'grub bo //
analyzed: gzhan du na rkyen de dag yod cing tshogs pas 'grub bo //
translated: Otherwise, it is established by the existence and convergence of those conditions.

original: de la bus pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa so so'i skye bo dag 'di snyam du sems te /🔽ngas las 'di mngon par 'du byas pa gang nga'i rnam par smin pa /
analyzed: de la bus pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa so so'i skye bo dag 'di snyam du sems te / ngas las 'di mngon par 'du byas pa gang nga'i rnam par smin pa /
translated: Regarding this, immature, uneducated ordinary people think like this:

original: so so yang dag par myong bar bya'o //
analyzed: so so yang dag par myong bar bya'o //
translated: “I will experience the ripening of whatever action I create.”

original: zhes de ltar nga rgyal la mngon par zhen pa yod pas 'khor ba'i rgyun mi 'chad do //
analyzed: zhes de ltar nga rgyal la mngon par zhen pa yod pas 'khor ba'i rgyun mi 'chad do //
translated: Thus, because of the attachment to pride, the continuity of saṃsāra is unbroken.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: “The knowledge and vision of this, up to the expertise,

original: lta ba'i zag pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lta ba'i zag pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: is called the knowledge of the defilement of views.

original: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: Householder, in this way

original: de bzhin gshegs pas lta ba'i zag pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas lta ba'i zag pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata knows as it really is the knowledge of the defilement of views.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lta ba'i zag pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lta ba'i zag pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to ask the Tathāgata about this knowledge of the defilement of views, he would answer for an eon or more, and so on, up to he would enjoy it.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The origin, the cessation, and the path are as previously explained.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: “Householder, how does

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ma rig pa'i zag pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ma rig pa'i zag pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: the Tathāgata know as it really is the knowledge of the defilement of ignorance?🔽“Householder, the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the defilement of ignorance is vast and unobstructed.

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /🔽ma rig pa ni /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te / ma rig pa ni /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata thoroughly knows this:🔽‘Ignorance is the obscuration of seeing things as they are,

original: ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba la sgrib pa dang / chad @154b pa dang / mun pa dang / mig ma yin par byed pa dang / shes rab 'gog pa dang / phongs pa'i phyogs dang / mya ngan las 'das par yang dag par 'jug par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba la sgrib pa dang / chad @154b pa dang / mun pa dang / mig ma yin par byed pa dang / shes rab 'gog pa dang / phongs pa'i phyogs dang / mya ngan las 'das par yang dag par 'jug par mi byed pa'o //
translated: the darkness, the non-eye, the cessation of wisdom, the side of poverty, and the non-entry into nirvāṇa.’

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: “Here, the knowledge and seeing up to the expertise

original: ma rig pa'i zag pa shes bya ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i zag pa shes bya ste /
translated: is the knowledge of the defilement of ignorance.

original: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: Householder, thus

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ma rig pa'i zag pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ma rig pa'i zag pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the defilement of ignorance is thoroughly known as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma rig pa'i zag pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma rig pa'i zag pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to ask the Tathāgata about that knowledge of the defilement of ignorance, he would answer for an eon or longer.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: the origin, the cessation, and the path are just as they have been taught.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas zad pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas zad pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata know extinction exactly as it is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows thus:

original: gang nyon mongs pa zad pa de zag pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: gang nyon mongs pa zad pa de zag pa zad pa'o //
translated: “That which is the extinction of afflictions is the extinction of defilements.

original: gang zag pa zad pa de nyon mongs pa zad cing de sdug bsngal zad pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag pa zad pa de nyon mongs pa zad cing de sdug bsngal zad pa'o //
translated: That which is the extinction of defilements is the extinction of afflictions and the extinction of suffering.

original: gang sdug bsngal zad pa de mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal zad pa de mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is the extinction of suffering is called nirvāṇa.

original: 'khor ba'i lam du mi 'jug go /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i lam du mi 'jug go /
translated: It does not enter the path of saṃsāra.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas zad pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas zad pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata knows extinction exactly as it is.

original: de la shes pa nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: That which is knowledge up to skill regarding that is called

original: zad pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the knowledge of extinction.

original: de @155a *// bzhin gshegs pa zad pa shes pa de'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de @155a *// bzhin gshegs pa zad pa shes pa de'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: When asked about the knowledge of cessation, the Tathāgata would have to teach for an eon, and so on up to: he would have to teach for a long time.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: The same applies to the knowledge of the origin of suffering, the knowledge of the cessation of suffering, and the knowledge of the path.🔽“Householder, how does the Tathāgata, who is fully awakened with regard to the world,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mi skye ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mi skye ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: know and see the world as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows and sees as it really is:

original: sred pa'i rkyen gyis sdug bsngal 'grub la /
analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen gyis sdug bsngal 'grub la /
translated: ‘Suffering is established through the condition of craving.

original: shes pa'i dbang gis de'i spong ba 'grub ste /
analyzed: shes pa'i dbang gis de'i spong ba 'grub ste /
translated: Through the power of knowledge, its abandonment is established.’

original: de ltar na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas mi skye ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de ltar na / de bzhin gshegs pas mi skye ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: In this way,🔽the Tathāgata knows and sees the world as it really is.

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis nyon mongs pa spong ba yongs su mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa shes pa gang gis nyon mongs pa spong ba yongs su mkhyen te /
translated: “Moreover, householder, the Tathāgata knows and sees as it really is, through a certain knowledge, the abandonment of the afflictions.

original: de ni / mi skye ba shes pa'o //🔽de la shes pa nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni; mi skye ba shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni / mi skye ba shes pa'o // de la shes pa nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni; mi skye ba shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is the knowledge of non-arising.🔽“The knowledge of non-arising is the knowledge of the non-arising of all dharmas.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has understood as it really is the knowledge of non-arising.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi skye ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi skye ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If someone were to ask a question about the knowledge of non-arising of the Tathāgata, he could answer it for an eon or for the remainder of an eon.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //🔽khyim bdag / @155b ji ltar na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no // khyim bdag / @155b ji ltar na / de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: The origination, cessation, flavor, danger, and escape of the knowledge of non-arising are also like that.🔽“Householder, how does the Tathāgata have the knowledge of the understanding of all dharmas?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad la gzhan la rag ma lus pa'i shes pa la dmigs nas ngas mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas pa'i chos gang yang med de /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad la gzhan la rag ma lus pa'i shes pa la dmigs nas ngas mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas pa'i chos gang yang med de /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata, having focused on the knowledge of all dharmas that is independent of others, has understood as it really is: ‘There is no dharma that I have not fully awakened to.’

original: gang pha rol dag gis de chos 'di dag la mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so //
analyzed: gang pha rol dag gis de chos 'di dag la mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so //
translated: Others will say, He has not fully awakened to these dharmas.

original: zhes rgol ba la bsnyengs pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: zhes rgol ba la bsnyengs pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He is not afraid of anyone who might argue that he has not fully awakened to these dharmas.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ma lus par thugs su chud pa la bzhugs so //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ma lus par thugs su chud pa la bzhugs so //
translated: Thus, he abides in the realization of all the Tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma lus par thugs su chud pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma lus par thugs su chud pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: And when he is asked about the realization of all the Tathāgatas, he answers for an eon, or even longer than an eon.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: The origination, cessation, and path are just as they are taught.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas don so so yang dag par rig pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas don so so yang dag par rig pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the understanding of the meaning as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas don so so yang dag par rig pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /🔽yi ge 'di ni /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas don so so yang dag par rig pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te / yi ge 'di ni /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows the knowledge of the understanding of the meaning like this:

original: don ston te /
analyzed: don ston te /
translated: “These letters indicate the meaning.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: chos kyi don dang / sems can gyi don dang / srog med pa'i don dang / gang zag med pa'i don dang / stong pa nyid yongs su bstan pa'i don dang / mtshan @156a *//
analyzed: chos kyi don dang / sems can gyi don dang / srog med pa'i don dang / gang zag med pa'i don dang / stong pa nyid yongs su bstan pa'i don dang / mtshan @156a *//
translated: the meaning of the Dharma, the meaning of sentient beings, the meaning of the absence of life force, the meaning of the absence of individuals, the meaning of the teaching on emptiness,

original: ma dang bral ba'i don dang / smon lam dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: ma dang bral ba'i don dang / smon lam dang bral ba ste /
translated: the meaning of the absence of marks, and the meaning of the absence of wishes.

original: de'ang 'dir brjod par bya zhing 'di ltar mngon du dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'ang 'dir brjod par bya zhing 'di ltar mngon du dpyad par bya ste /
translated: “This should be expressed and analyzed in the following way:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: mi rtag pa zhe'am /
analyzed: mi rtag pa zhe'am /
translated: impermanent,

original: sdug bsngal ba zhe'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba zhe'am /
translated: suffering,

original: bdag med pa zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag med pa zhe'am /
translated: selfless,

original: mtshan ma dang bral ba zhe'am /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bral ba zhe'am /
translated: free from marks,

original: smon pa dang bral ba zhe'am /
analyzed: smon pa dang bral ba zhe'am /
translated: free from wishes,

original: zhi ba zhe'am /
analyzed: zhi ba zhe'am /
translated: peaceful,🔽free from conceit,

original: rlom sems med pa zhe'am; bdag 'dul ba zhe'am /🔽mngon par 'du mi byed pa zhe'am /
analyzed: rlom sems med pa zhe'am; bdag 'dul ba zhe'am / mngon par 'du mi byed pa zhe'am /
translated: self-tamed,🔽free from activity,

original: spros pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spros pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and free from conceptual elaboration.

original: yi ge 'di dag ni /
analyzed: yi ge 'di dag ni /
translated: “These syllables

original: dus dang ldan par so sor brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dus dang ldan par so sor brjod par bya ste /
translated: should be expressed in a timely manner.

original: bdag tu mngon par chags pa dag gi dus su ni /
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par chags pa dag gi dus su ni /
translated: When there is attachment to a self,

original: stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid do //
translated: it is emptiness.

original: mtshan ma la mngon par chags pa dag gi dus su ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma la mngon par chags pa dag gi dus su ni /
translated: For those who are attached to signs,

original: mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: it is signlessness.

original: smon lam la mngon par chags pa dag gi dus su ni /
analyzed: smon lam la mngon par chags pa dag gi dus su ni /
translated: For those who are attached to vows,

original: smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'o //
translated: it is wishlessness.

original: bsam pa rnam par spyod pa dag la ni /
analyzed: bsam pa rnam par spyod pa dag la ni /
translated: For those who are engaged in the purification of intentions,

original: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: it is the analytical knowledge of eloquence.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: “The knowledge and vision of that knowledge, up to the expertise,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: is called the knowledge of analytical knowledge.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully known that knowledge as it really is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa so so yang dag par rig pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs @156b spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa so so yang dag par rig pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs @156b spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to ask questions about the Tathāgata’s knowledge of analytical knowledge for an eon, or for the remainder of an eon, one could ask question after question, and each question would be different.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The origin, cessation, and path are as previously explained.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, how is it

original: de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “How does the Tathāgata know the characteristics of the Tathāgata as they are in reality?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata knows the four characteristics of the Tathāgata as they are in reality.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: glang po che ltar gzigs pa nyid dang / sengge ltar rnam par bsgyings pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa la 'jug pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad kyi lam dang rjes su mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: glang po che ltar gzigs pa nyid dang / sengge ltar rnam par bsgyings pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa la 'jug pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad kyi lam dang rjes su mthun pa nyid do //
translated: the manner of looking like an elephant, the manner of stretching like a lion, the manner of entering the thoughts of all sentient beings, and the manner of being in accord with the paths and actions of all sentient beings.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni; de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni; de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: “The knowledge, seeing, up to the skill regarding this is called ‘the knowledge of the characteristics of the Tathāgata.’🔽The Tathāgata knows it as it is.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Furthermore, the Tathāgata knows the characteristics of the Tathāgata as they are in reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan nyid shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan nyid shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal bar lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you ask the Tathāgata about the knowledge of the characteristics, he would explain it to you for an eon, or for even more than an eon.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: The same goes for the arising of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /🔽khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs @157a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na / khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs @157a *//
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata, who is thus gone, know the knowledge of the abodes of beings as it really is?

original: pas sems can thams cad kyi don du byams pa sgom par mdzad de /
analyzed: pas sems can thams cad kyi don du byams pa sgom par mdzad de /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata cultivates loving kindness for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: ngas sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: ngas sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: I will protect these sentient beings

original: skye ba'i 'jigs pa las bskyab par bya /
analyzed: skye ba'i 'jigs pa las bskyab par bya /
translated: from the danger of birth,

original: rga ba'i 'jigs pa dang / nad kyi 'jigs pa dang / 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa las bskyal par bya /
analyzed: rga ba'i 'jigs pa dang / nad kyi 'jigs pa dang / 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa las bskyal par bya /
translated: from the danger of old age, from the danger of sickness, and from the danger of death.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir byams pa sgom pa 'di ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir byams pa sgom pa 'di ni /
translated: I will cultivate loving kindness for the sake of the welfare and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa dang po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa dang po'o //
translated: This is the Tathāgata’s first abode.

original: kye ae ma sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: kye ae ma sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: Alas!🔽These sentient beings are🔽

original: sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: “Alas, these beings are suffering!

original: de dag gi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i don du chos bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i don du chos bstan par bya'o //
translated: I will teach the Dharma in order to remove their suffering.

original: gzhan ma yin pa 'phags pa'i lam gyis thar par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa 'phags pa'i lam gyis thar par bya'o //
translated: I will liberate them through the noble path that is not false.

original: zhes thugs rje bskyed par mdzad do //
analyzed: zhes thugs rje bskyed par mdzad do //
translated: ” Thus, he generates compassion.

original: gzhan ma yin pa'i lam 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'i lam 'di ni /
translated: “This path that is not false

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byed pa'o //
translated: will liberate them from suffering.

original: zhes dgyes pa bskyed par mdzad do //
