analyzed: zhes dgyes pa bskyed par mdzad do //
translated: ” Thus, he generates joy.

original: dgyes pa de sdug bsngal thams cad las btang snyoms su mdzad cing /
analyzed: dgyes pa de sdug bsngal thams cad las btang snyoms su mdzad cing /
translated: That joy is the equanimity that is free from all suffering.

original: sems dpa' med pa'i btang snyoms bskyed par mdzad do /
analyzed: sems dpa' med pa'i btang snyoms bskyed par mdzad do /
translated: He generates the equanimity that is free from the thought of a self.

original: 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni /
translated: These are

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: the four abodes of the Tathāgata.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: “The knowledge, the seeing, up to the skillfulness

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: that is called the Tathāgata’s abode of knowledge.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has perfectly and fully known it.

original: de bzhin gshegs @157b pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @157b pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: “Householder, when you ask, ‘How does the Tathāgata, who is skilled in the knowledge of the Tathāgata’s powers, answer questions?

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: ’ it is like the knowledge of the origin, cessation, and path.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na; khyim bdag /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na / de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na; khyim bdag /
translated: “Householder, when you ask, ‘How does the Tathāgata, who is skilled in the knowledge of the Tathāgata’s powers, answer questions?🔽’ it is like the knowledge of the Tathāgata’s powers.🔽“Householder, the Tathāgata, who is skilled in the knowledge of the Tathāgata’s powers, knows as it really is: ‘Bodhisattvas who have practiced the thirty-seven aspects of the branches of awakening for ten million eons will attain the acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena.’🔽“Householder, the Tathāgata, who is skilled in the knowledge of the Tathāgata’s powers, knows as it really is: ‘Bodhisattvas who have practiced the thirty-seven aspects of the branches of awakening for a hundred thousand eons will attain the acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena.’

original: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas bskal pa bye ba dpag tu med par byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yang dag par sgrub pa la don du gnyer ba nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas bskal pa bye ba dpag tu med par byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yang dag par sgrub pa la don du gnyer ba nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata, who is skilled in the knowledge of the Tathāgata’s powers, knows as it really is: ‘Bodhisattvas who have practiced the thirty-seven aspects of the branches of awakening for a hundred eons will attain the acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena.’🔽“Householder, the Tathāgata, who is skilled in the knowledge of the Tathāgata’s powers, knows as it really is: ‘Bodhisattvas who have practiced the thirty-seven aspects of the branches of awakening for ten thousand eons will attain the acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena.’🔽“Householder, the Tathāgata, who is skilled in the knowledge of the Tathāgata’s powers, knows as it really is: ‘Bodhisattvas who have practiced the thirty-seven aspects of the branches of awakening for a thousand eons will attain the acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena.’🔽“Householder, the Tathāgata, who is skilled in the knowledge of the Tathāgata’s powers, knows as it really is: ‘Bodhisattvas who have practiced the thirty-seven aspects of the branches of awakening for a hundred eons will attain the acceptance of the nonarising

original: dang pa'i sems dang / rnyog pa med pa'i sems dang / dkrugs pa med pa'i sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to; ;byang chub kyi sems la gzhol ba dang / sems rab tu bsdus pa dang / sems kyi rgyun brjed pa med pa dang /
analyzed: dang pa'i sems dang / rnyog pa med pa'i sems dang / dkrugs pa med pa'i sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to; ;byang chub kyi sems la gzhol ba dang / sems rab tu bsdus pa dang / sems kyi rgyun brjed pa med pa dang /
translated: He knows the mind that is focused on awakening, the mind that is completely concentrated, the mind that is not forgetful,

original: sems kyi rgyun ma g-yengs pa dang / nyon mongs pa med par gyur pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun ma g-yengs pa dang / nyon mongs pa med par gyur pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: and the mind that is undistracted. He knows the wisdom that is free from afflictions.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Thus-Gone One knows all of this just as it is.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / gsal ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud pa dang / mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: The knowledge, seeing, illumination, realization, complete understanding, and expertise that come from this

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: are called the Thus-Gone One’s knowledge of faculties.

original: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: Householder, in this way

original: @158a *// de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: @158a *// de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata accurately knows the Tathāgata’s knowledge of faculties.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If someone were to ask the Tathāgata questions about that knowledge of faculties, the Tathāgata would answer them, and he would continue to do so for an eon or the remainder of an eon.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: The same is true of the knowledge of the origination, cessation, and path.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi las shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi las shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata accurately know the knowledge of physical action?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi las shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi las shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata accurately knows the knowledge of physical action.

original: srog gcod pa spong ba dang / ma byin par len pa spong ba dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa spong ba ste /
analyzed: srog gcod pa spong ba dang / ma byin par len pa spong ba dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa spong ba ste /
translated: He knows the abandonment of killing, the abandonment of taking what has not been given, and the abandonment of sexual misconduct.

original: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: Householder, that is how the Tathāgata accurately knows the knowledge of physical action.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi las dge ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi las dge ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: The Tathāgata accurately knows the wholesome actions of the body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi las mi dge ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi las mi dge ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata accurately know the unwholesome actions of the body?

original: 'di la srog gcod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: 'di la srog gcod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen /
translated: Here, he accurately knows killing,

original: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /🔽khyim bdag / de ltar na /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te / khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: he accurately knows taking what is not given, and he accurately knows sexual misconduct.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas @158b lus kyi las mi dge ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas @158b lus kyi las mi dge ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: Householder, thus the Tathāgata accurately knows the unwholesome actions of the body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi las lung du ma bstan pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi las lung du ma bstan pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata accurately know the indeterminate actions of the body?

original: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi las bsam pa las byung ba'i rnam par smin pa ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi las bsam pa las byung ba'i rnam par smin pa ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata fully knows, just as it is, the physical actions that are not the ripening of mental intentions.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: “The knowledge, seeing, discernment, intelligence, and realization that are in regard to that are called

original: lus kyi las shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lus kyi las shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: ‘the knowledge of physical actions.’🔽The Tathāgata fully knows, just as it is, the knowledge of physical actions.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to; ;de bzhin gshegs pa lus kyi las shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to; ;de bzhin gshegs pa lus kyi las shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: The Tathāgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, when asked about this knowledge of physical actions, would explain it for eons, for more than eons, for hundreds of eons, for thousands of eons, for hundreds of thousands of eons, for hundreds of thousands of millions of eons, for hundreds of thousands of billions of eons, for hundreds of thousands of quintillions of eons, and he would still not finish explaining it.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //🔽bam po dgu pa /🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no // bam po dgu pa / khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: The knowledge of the origination, the knowledge of the cessation, and the knowledge of the path are also as explained above.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ngag gi las sems pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ngag gi las sems pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the mental actions that are the ripening of mental intentions, just as they are?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas ngag gi las dge ba rnam pa bzhi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas ngag gi las dge ba rnam pa bzhi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata has understood as it really is the four kinds of wholesome verbal action:

original: brdzun du smra ba spangs pa dang / phra ma smra ba spangs pa dang / ngag rtsub po spangs pa dang / tshig kyal pa spangs pa ste /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba spangs pa dang / phra ma smra ba spangs pa dang / ngag rtsub po spangs pa dang / tshig kyal pa spangs pa ste /
translated: abandoning false speech, abandoning divisive speech, abandoning harsh speech, and abandoning idle chatter.

original: ngag gi las kyi dge ba rnam pa bzhi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: ngag gi las kyi dge ba rnam pa bzhi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He has understood as it really is the four kinds of wholesome verbal action.

original: brdzun du smra ba @159a *//
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba @159a *//
translated: False speech,

original: dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa ste /
analyzed: dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa ste /
translated: divisive speech, harsh speech, and idle chatter.

original: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: Householder, thus

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ngag gi las mi dge ba rnam pa bzhi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ngag gi las mi dge ba rnam pa bzhi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata has understood as it really is the four kinds of unwholesome verbal action.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: “Householder, how

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ngag gi las lung du ma bstan pa rnam pa bzhi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ngag gi las lung du ma bstan pa rnam pa bzhi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: does the Tathāgata understand as it really is the four kinds of indeterminate verbal action?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par yongs su spyad pa dang / mi mthun par yongs su spyad pa dang / dus tshigs kyis rnam par bsgyur ba dang / spyod lam las byung ba'i ngag gi las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par yongs su spyad pa dang / mi mthun par yongs su spyad pa dang / dus tshigs kyis rnam par bsgyur ba dang / spyod lam las byung ba'i ngag gi las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata accurately knows the speech activity that is practiced correctly, the speech activity that is practiced incorrectly, the speech activity that is modified by the seasons, and the speech activity that arises from deportment.

original: de la shes pa nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: “The knowledge of that, up to the discernment of that, is the knowledge of speech activity.

original: ngag gi las shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ngag gi las shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the knowledge of speech activity.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, having known the knowledge of speech activity, teaches the Dharma to others through various accomplishments of speech activity, various aspects of speech activity, various manifestations of speech activity, and various expressions of speech activity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ngag gi las shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ngag gi las shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: When asked about that knowledge of speech activity of the Tathāgata, he would answer for an eon and beyond, and still his knowledge of speech activity would not be exhausted.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhi no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhi no //
translated: The origination, the cessation, and the path are as previously stated.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: “Householder, how is it that the Tathāgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, having known the knowledge of speech activity, teaches the Dharma to others through various accomplishments of speech activity, various aspects of speech activity, various manifestations of speech activity, and various expressions of speech activity?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas yid kyi las shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu @159b mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yid kyi las shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu @159b mkhyen ce na /
translated: How does the Tathāgata know the mind’s activity as it really is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas yid kyi las dge ba rnam pa gsum rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas yid kyi las dge ba rnam pa gsum rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata knows the three kinds of virtuous mental activity:

original: brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: the absence of covetousness, the absence of ill will, and right view.

original: yid kyi las mi dge ba rnam pa gsum rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: yid kyi las mi dge ba rnam pa gsum rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows the three kinds of nonvirtuous mental activity:

original: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba'o //
translated: covetousness, ill will, and wrong view.

original: yid kyi las lung du ma bstan pa rnam pa gsum yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: yid kyi las lung du ma bstan pa rnam pa gsum yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows the three kinds of indeterminate mental activity as they really are:

original: yang dag par yongs su spyad pa dang / mi mthun par yongs su spyad pa dang / spyod lam las byung ba dang / dus tshigs kyis rnam par bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par yongs su spyad pa dang / mi mthun par yongs su spyad pa dang / spyod lam las byung ba dang / dus tshigs kyis rnam par bsgyur ba'o //
translated: those that are conducive to right practice, those that are conducive to wrong practice, those that arise from deportment, and those that arise from change in the seasons.

original: de la shes pa nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: Here, knowledge up to skill regarding this is

original: yid kyi las shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yid kyi las shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: called ‘knowledge of the mind’s activity.’

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has understood it just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yid kyi las shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yid kyi las shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If someone were to ask the Tathāgata about this knowledge of mental activity, the Tathāgata would answer them. He would speak for an eon or for the remainder of an eon.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: The origin, the cessation, and the path are just as they are taught.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sngon du 'gro ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /🔽khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu shes pa sngon du 'gro bar byas nas lus kyi las rtsom /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sngon du 'gro ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na / khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu shes pa sngon du 'gro bar byas nas lus kyi las rtsom /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the knowledge that precedes?

original: ngag gi las rtsom /
analyzed: ngag gi las rtsom /
translated: Householder, in this case, the Tathāgata, having made the knowledge of the ten powers precede, undertakes physical activity, undertakes verbal activity,

original: yid @160a *// kyi las rtsom mo //
analyzed: yid @160a *// kyi las rtsom mo //
translated: and undertakes mental activity.

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas gal te zad pa shes pa'am /🔽gal te mi skye ba shes pa'am /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas gal te zad pa shes pa'am / gal te mi skye ba shes pa'am /
translated: Moreover, householder, the Tathāgata, if it is the knowledge of exhaustion,🔽if it is the knowledge of non-arising,

original: gal te 'khor ba shes pa'am /
analyzed: gal te 'khor ba shes pa'am /
translated: if it is the knowledge of saṃsāra,

original: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa shes pa sngon du 'gro bar byas pa nas yid kyi las rtsom pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa shes pa sngon du 'gro bar byas pa nas yid kyi las rtsom pa'i bar du'o //
translated: “If one has preceded with the knowledge of nirvāṇa, then one will commence the activity of the mind.

original: de la shes pa nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: “Here, the knowledge and skill that are from that knowledge

original: sngon du 'gro ba shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sngon du 'gro ba shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: are called ‘the knowledge of what precedes.’

original: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has perfect knowledge of that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sngon du 'gro ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sngon du 'gro ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: “If one were to ask how the Tathāgata’s knowledge of what precedes is, then the answer would be for an eon, or longer than an eon.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: The origination, cessation, and path are as previously explained.🔽“Householder, how does the Tathāgata have the knowledge of what follows?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su 'jug pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su 'jug pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata has the knowledge of what follows.

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi las thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i rjes su 'jug pa yin no //🔽zhes rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas lus kyi las thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i rjes su 'jug pa yin no // zhes rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, here the Tathāgata fully knows all physical actions as following after the ten powers of the Tathāgata.

original: lus kyi las gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dag gis yongs su shes pa ma bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: lus kyi las gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dag gis yongs su shes pa ma bskyed pa'am /
translated: He fully knows all physical actions as not being produced by the ten powers of the Tathāgata,

original: mi gnas pa'am /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'am /
translated: as not remaining,🔽and as not ceasing.

original: mi 'gag pa de @160b med de; de bzhin du ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las la'ang bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'gag pa de @160b med de; de bzhin du ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las la'ang bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to verbal actions and mental actions.

original: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: The knowledge, seeing, up to the skillfulness regarding that is

original: rjes su 'jug pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: called ‘knowledge of following after.’

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas gang dmigs par mdzad pa'i mkhyen pa des rnam par dpyod par mdzad de /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas gang dmigs par mdzad pa'i mkhyen pa des rnam par dpyod par mdzad de /
translated: “Moreover, householder, the Tathāgata, with the knowledge that he directs toward a specific object, analyzes

original: byams pa dang ldan pa'i thugs kyis sems can la dmigs pa gnod pa med par 'jig rten gnas pa la gzigs pa na lam gol bar rab tu zhugs pa srid pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad gnod pa dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang /
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan pa'i thugs kyis sems can la dmigs pa gnod pa med par 'jig rten gnas pa la gzigs pa na lam gol bar rab tu zhugs pa srid pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad gnod pa dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang /
translated: When the Tathāgata, with a mind full of love, looks at the world with a mind free from harm, he sees that all beings are on a mistaken path, that all beings are subject to suffering, old age, sickness,

original: 'chi ba yod pa dag gis nyen par thugs su chud nas thams cad du mkhyen pas dpyod par mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: 'chi ba yod pa dag gis nyen par thugs su chud nas thams cad du mkhyen pas dpyod par mdzad pa ni /
translated: and death. Having understood this, he examines everything with his omniscience.

original: phung po kun spangs pa ma gtogs par gzhan du cung zad kyang gnod pa med par ma gzigs te /
analyzed: phung po kun spangs pa ma gtogs par gzhan du cung zad kyang gnod pa med par ma gzigs te /
translated: He sees nothing at all that is free from harm except for the abandonment of the aggregates.

original: de'i mkhyen pa des thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug go /
analyzed: de'i mkhyen pa des thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug go /
translated: His knowledge penetrates everything.

original: gnod pa yang gang kun nas mnar sems dang / gnod pa spong ba'i phyir gnod pa med pa yongs su mkhyen to //
analyzed: gnod pa yang gang kun nas mnar sems dang / gnod pa spong ba'i phyir gnod pa med pa yongs su mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the harm that is the mental affliction of malice and the harm that is the abandonment of malice.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: In this way,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su 'jug pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su 'jug pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata knows the knowledge of engagement just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rjes su 'jug pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //🔽kun 'byung ba @161a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rjes su 'jug pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro // kun 'byung ba @161a *//
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata knows the origin of suffering as it really is, in the sense that the origin of suffering is the cause, origin, arising, and condition of suffering.🔽“Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the cessation of suffering, as it really is?🔽Householder, the Tathāgata knows the cessation of suffering as it really is, in the sense that the cessation of suffering is the stopping, abandonment, and cessation of that very craving.🔽“Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the path to the cessation of suffering, as it really is?🔽Householder, the Tathāgata knows the path to the cessation of suffering as it really is, in the sense that the path to the cessation of suffering is the noble path with eight parts: namely, right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.🔽“Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the perfection of the practice, as it really is?

original: dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata knows the perfection of the practice, as it really is, in the sense that the perfection of the practice is the practice of the path.

original: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the various dispositions of beings, as they really are?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mi nyam pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /🔽khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dag las yongs su mi nyam mo; ;khyim bdag /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mi nyam pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na / khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dag las yongs su mi nyam mo; ;khyim bdag /
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata knows the various dispositions of beings, as they really are, in the sense that the various dispositions of beings are the various dispositions of beings.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas shes pa gang thugs su chud pa de las yongs su mi nyam ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas shes pa gang thugs su chud pa de las yongs su mi nyam ste /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the higher and lower faculties of other beings and other persons, as they really are?

original: 'dod chags spang ba shes pa dang / zhe sdang spang ba shes pa dang / gti mug spang ba shes pa de las kyang yongs su mi nyam mo //🔽shes pa gang thugs su chud pa de ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags spang ba shes pa dang / zhe sdang spang ba shes pa dang / gti mug spang ba shes pa de las kyang yongs su mi nyam mo // shes pa gang thugs su chud pa de ni /
translated: He does not become proud because of his knowledge of the abandonment of desire, his knowledge of the abandonment of hatred, or his knowledge of the abandonment of confusion.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa shes pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te lam shes pa dang / rjes su dran pa shes pa dang / zhi gnas shes pa dang / lhag mthong shes pa dang / rig pa shes pa dang / rnam par grol ba shes pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa shes pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te lam shes pa dang / rjes su dran pa shes pa dang / zhi gnas shes pa dang / lhag mthong shes pa dang / rig pa shes pa dang / rnam par grol ba shes pa dang /
translated: He does not become proud because of his knowledge of the four applications of mindfulness, and similarly, his knowledge of the path, his knowledge of recollection, his knowledge of tranquility, his knowledge of special insight, his knowledge of awareness, his knowledge of liberation,🔽his knowledge of exhaustion, his knowledge of non-arising, his knowledge of thorough understanding, his knowledge of abandonment, his knowledge of cultivation, his knowledge of realization, his knowledge of the aspects of spiritual powers,

original: zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / yongs su shes pa dang / spang ba shes pa dang / bsgom pa shes pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / yongs su shes pa dang / spang ba shes pa dang / bsgom pa shes pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa shes pa dang /
translated: his knowledge of the superknowledges, his knowledge of the aggregates, his knowledge of the elements, his knowledge of the sense bases, his knowledge of the truths, his knowledge of the constituents, his knowledge of the vehicles,

original: lha'i mig shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba shes pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa dang / @161b rgyu shes pa dang / 'bras bu shes pa dang / 'jug pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: lha'i mig shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba shes pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa dang / @161b rgyu shes pa dang / 'bras bu shes pa dang / 'jug pa shes pa dang /
translated: It is the knowledge of the divine eye, the knowledge of the divine ear, the knowledge of the minds of others, the knowledge of former lives, the knowledge of the exhaustion of defilements, the knowledge of causes, the knowledge of results, the knowledge of engagement,

original: ldog pa shes pa dang / phung po shes pa dang / khams shes pa dang / skye mched shes pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa dang / dbang po shes pa dang / stobs shes pa dang / bden pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: ldog pa shes pa dang / phung po shes pa dang / khams shes pa dang / skye mched shes pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa dang / dbang po shes pa dang / stobs shes pa dang / bden pa shes pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of disengagement, the knowledge of the aggregates, the knowledge of the elements, the knowledge of the sense sources, the knowledge of dependent origination, the knowledge of the faculties, the knowledge of the powers, the knowledge of the truths,

original: 'khor ba shes pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa shes pa dang; dus shes pa dang / dus ma yin pa shes pa dang / rigs pa shes pa dang / mngon sum pa shes pa dang / bzod pa shes pa dang / ring ba shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'khor ba shes pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa shes pa dang; dus shes pa dang / dus ma yin pa shes pa dang / rigs pa shes pa dang / mngon sum pa shes pa dang / bzod pa shes pa dang / ring ba shes pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of saṃsāra, the knowledge of nirvāṇa, the knowledge of time, the knowledge of non-time, the knowledge of logic, the knowledge of direct perception, the knowledge of patience, the knowledge of distance,🔽and the knowledge of nearness.

original: nye ba shes pa dang / 'byung ba shes pa dang / mi 'byung ba shes pa dang / bsgoms pa shes pa dang / ma bsgoms pa shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / kun nas mnar sems shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang /🔽don dam pa shes pa'i bar te /
analyzed: nye ba shes pa dang / 'byung ba shes pa dang / mi 'byung ba shes pa dang / bsgoms pa shes pa dang / ma bsgoms pa shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / kun nas mnar sems shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / don dam pa shes pa'i bar te /
translated: knowledge of the proximate, knowledge of the elements, knowledge of non-arising, knowledge of cultivation, knowledge of non-cultivation, knowledge of extinction, knowledge of complete affliction, knowledge of convention,🔽up to knowledge of the ultimate.🔽🔽

original: de ltar na /🔽sangs rgyas ni /🔽shes pa mtha' yas pa de las yongs su mi nyam mo //🔽de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /🔽yongs su mi nyam pa shes pa zhes bya ste /🔽de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //🔽de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mi nyam pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na /🔽sangs rgyas ni /🔽shes pa mtha' yas pa de las yongs su mi nyam mo //🔽de la shes pa dang / mthong ba nas mkhas pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di ni /🔽yongs su mi nyam pa shes pa zhes bya ste /🔽de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //🔽de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mi nyam pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //

original: @162a *// kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: @162a *// kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam yang ji skad bstan pa bzhin no // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: the path, just as they have been taught.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the knowledge of the all-knowing one just as it is?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas gzhan las ma gsan par chos thams cad bdag nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas gzhan las ma gsan par chos thams cad bdag nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: Householder, here the Tathāgata, without listening to others, has fully awakened by himself to all phenomena.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par rtogs pa la mkhas pas chos nyan pa po'i dbang gis dus dang dus ma yin pa la mkhas /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par rtogs pa la mkhas pas chos nyan pa po'i dbang gis dus dang dus ma yin pa la mkhas /
translated: In that, the Tathāgata, through the skill of true realization, is skilled in the timely and untimely with regard to the listener of the Dharma.

original: sems can dag gi bsam pa la mkhas pas dus las mi 'da' ba la mkhas /
analyzed: sems can dag gi bsam pa la mkhas pas dus las mi 'da' ba la mkhas /
translated: Through the skill of the thoughts of beings, he is skilled in not passing beyond the time.🔽Through the skill of ripening, he is skilled in the vessel.

original: yongs su smin par bya ba la mkhas pas snod la mkhas; chos ston pas chos nyan pa po dag gi thabs dang / chos yang dag par thob par bya ba la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su smin par bya ba la mkhas pas snod la mkhas; chos ston pas chos nyan pa po dag gi thabs dang / chos yang dag par thob par bya ba la mkhas pa ste /
translated: Through teaching the Dharma, he is skilled in the means of the listeners of the Dharma and in the attainment of the Dharma.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: In that way,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows as it really is the knowledge of the Omniscient One.

original: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas sems can thams cad kyi dbang po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /🔽sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas sems can thams cad kyi dbang po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te / sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: “Moreover, O layman, the Tathāgata knows as it really is the faculties of all sentient beings.

original: 'dod chags kyi bsam pa can no //🔽sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi bsam pa can no // sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: These sentient beings have the disposition of desire.

original: zhe sdang gi bsam pa can no //🔽@162b sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi bsam pa can no // @162b sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: These sentient beings have the disposition of anger.

original: gti mug gi bsam pa can no //🔽sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: gti mug gi bsam pa can no // sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: These sentient beings have the disposition of delusion.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi bsam pa can no //🔽sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi bsam pa can no // sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: These sentient beings have the disposition of desire and anger.

original: 'dod chags dang gti mug gi bsam pa can no //🔽sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang gti mug gi bsam pa can no // sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: These sentient beings have the disposition of desire and delusion.

original: zhe sdang dang gti mug gi bsam pa can no //🔽sems can 'di dag ni /🔽gti mug dang 'dod chags kyi bsam pa can no; ;sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang gti mug gi bsam pa can no // sems can 'di dag ni / gti mug dang 'dod chags kyi bsam pa can no; ;sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: These sentient beings have the disposition of anger and delusion.🔽These sentient beings have the disposition of delusion and desire.

original: gti mug dang zhe sdang gi bsam pa can no //
analyzed: gti mug dang zhe sdang gi bsam pa can no //
translated: These sentient beings have the disposition of delusion and anger.

original: sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: These sentient beings🔽

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi bsam pa can no; ;sems can 'di dag ni /🔽bsam pa dge la sbyor ba nag go /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi bsam pa can no; ;sems can 'di dag ni / bsam pa dge la sbyor ba nag go /
translated: These sentient beings have thoughts of desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: sems can 'di dag ni /🔽bsam pa nag la sbyor ba dge ba'o //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni / bsam pa nag la sbyor ba dge ba'o //
translated: These sentient beings have virtuous thoughts but unvirtuous actions.🔽These sentient beings have unvirtuous thoughts but virtuous actions.

original: sems can 'di dag ni; bsam pa nag la sbyor ba'ang nag pa'o //🔽sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni; bsam pa nag la sbyor ba'ang nag pa'o // sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: These sentient beings have unvirtuous thoughts and unvirtuous actions.

original: bsam pa dge la sbyor ba'ang dge'o //🔽sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: bsam pa dge la sbyor ba'ang dge'o // sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: These sentient beings have virtuous thoughts and virtuous actions.

original: zang zing la gdu la chos la mi gdu ba'o //🔽sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: zang zing la gdu la chos la mi gdu ba'o // sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: These sentient beings are devoted to material things but not to the Dharma.

original: chos la gdu la zang zing la mi gdu ba'o //🔽gang zag 'dis ni /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di lta bu zhig mngon par 'dus byas; sems 'di dag gis ni /
analyzed: chos la gdu la zang zing la mi gdu ba'o // gang zag 'dis ni / dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di lta bu zhig mngon par 'dus byas; sems 'di dag gis ni /
translated: These sentient beings are devoted to the Dharma but not to material things.🔽This person has created such and such roots of virtue.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di lta bu zhig mngon par 'dus byas /🔽gang zag 'di ni /🔽lam 'di lta bu zhig gis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di lta bu zhig mngon par 'dus byas / gang zag 'di ni / lam 'di lta bu zhig gis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur /
translated: These minds have created such and such roots of virtue.🔽This person will become afflicted by such and such a path.

original: @163a *// gang zag 'di ni /
analyzed: @163a *// gang zag 'di ni /
translated: This person will become afflicted by such and such a path.

original: lam 'di lta bu zhig gis rnam par dag par 'gyur /
analyzed: lam 'di lta bu zhig gis rnam par dag par 'gyur /
translated: “This is the path that leads to purification.

original: gang zag 'di ni /
analyzed: gang zag 'di ni /
translated: This person

original: byams pa 'di lta bu zhig gis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur /
analyzed: byams pa 'di lta bu zhig gis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur /
translated: is defiled by this kind of love.

original: gang zag 'di ni /
analyzed: gang zag 'di ni /
translated: This person

original: byams pa 'di lta bu zhig gis rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byams pa 'di lta bu zhig gis rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: is purified by this kind of love.”

original: zhes de ltar na /
analyzed: zhes de ltar na /
translated: In this way,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the omniscience of a tathāgata is perfectly pure.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: If one were to ask about the knowledge of the omniscience of a tathāgata, the answer would be given for an eon, and in the same way, for as many eons as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, how does the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the arising of the omniscience of a tathāgata correspond to reality?

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa yang dag par 'grub ba gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /🔽gal te sdug bsngal bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag gis thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa yang dag par 'grub ba gal te mi rtag par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am / gal te sdug bsngal bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata has said that if you abide in the view of impermanence,🔽or abide in the view of suffering,🔽or abide in the view of disease,🔽or abide in the view of a boil, or abide in the view of a thorn,

original: gal te nad du rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /🔽gal te 'bras su rjes su blta bar pa'am; gal te zug rngur rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /🔽gal te sdig par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas nyams par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /🔽gal te @163b g-yo bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te nad du rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am / gal te 'bras su rjes su blta bar pa'am; gal te zug rngur rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am / gal te sdig par rjes su blta bar gnas pa nas nyams par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am / gal te @163b g-yo bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: or abide in the view of calamity, or abide in the view of affliction,

original: rab tu 'jig par ram /🔽nyes par ram /
analyzed: rab tu 'jig par ram / nyes par ram /
translated: or abide in the view of destruction,

original: 'go ba'i nad du'am /
analyzed: 'go ba'i nad du'am /
translated: or abide in the view of a basis,🔽or abide in the view of emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid du'am /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du'am /
translated: or abide in the view of selflessness,🔽or abide in the view of the absence of enjoyment,🔽or abide in the view of danger,🔽or abide in the view of abandonment,🔽or abide in the view of disenchantment,🔽or abide in the view of cessation,🔽or abide in the view of relinquishment,🔽or abide in the view of pacification,🔽or abide in the view of extinction,🔽or abide in the view of absence,🔽or abide in the view of desirelessness,🔽or abide in the view of non-action,🔽or abide in the view of non-birth,🔽or abide in the view of non-production,

original: bdag med par ram /🔽gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: bdag med par ram / gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: or abide in the view of non-existence,🔽or abide in the view of non-affliction,🔽or abide in the view of non-purification,🔽or abide in the view of non-grasping,🔽or abide in the view of non-rejection,🔽or abide in the view of non-view,🔽or abide in the view of non-abiding,🔽or abide in the view of non-arising,🔽or abide in the view of non-cessation,🔽or abide in the view of non-affliction,🔽or abide in the view of non-purification,🔽or abide in the view of non-grasping,🔽or abide in the view of non-rejection,🔽or abide in the view of non-view,🔽or abide in the view of non-abiding,🔽or abide in the view of non-arising,🔽or abide in the view of non-cessation,🔽or abide in the view of non-affliction,🔽or abide in the view of non-purification,🔽or abide in the view of non-grasping,🔽or abide in the view of non-rejection,

original: gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: or abide in the view of non-view,🔽or abide in

original: gal te gnod par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te gnod par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: If they are abiding in the observation of harm,

original: gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to /
analyzed: gal te phyir rgol bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa'i bar de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to /
translated: up to if they are abiding in the observation of opposition, the Tathāgata knows them as they really are.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: “If you ask, ‘What is the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of all things?’,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Householder, if you ask, ‘How does the Tathāgata know as it really is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of all things?’,

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata has understood this:

original: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byas shing don ma yin pa bzlog la /
translated: having benefited countless sentient beings and turned them away from what is not beneficial,

original: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
analyzed: snang ba byas shing mun pa bsal te sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas nas bde ba la btsud pa ni /
translated: He has dispelled the darkness and liberated countless beings from suffering, establishing them in happiness.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog pa ste /
translated: “The knowledge of the cessation of omniscience

original: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: de'ang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i chos can no //
translated: is also unborn from the beginning.

original: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ltar na /
translated: Householder, in this way

original: @164a *// de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: @164a *// de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata perfectly knows the knowledge of the cessation of omniscience just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //🔽khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te longs spyod pa'i bar du 'gyur ro // khyim bdag / ji ltar na /
translated: If one were to ask questions about the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the cessation of omniscience, he would answer for an eon, or even longer than an eon.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Householder, how does the Tathāgata know the path that leads to the cessation of omniscience?🔽“

original: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata knows this thus:

original: shes pa gang gis thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa yongs su shes; khong du chud /
analyzed: shes pa gang gis thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa yongs su shes; khong du chud /
translated: “The knowledge by which the knowledge of the Tathāgata is known, understood,

original: mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: mngon sum du byas pa'i 'gog pa gal te ro myang ba med par rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: and actualized—if that knowledge is to be known by the knowledge of the cessation of suffering,

original: gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te nyes dmigs su rjes su blta bar gnas pa'am /
translated: if it is to be known by the knowledge of the danger of suffering,

original: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gal te nges par 'byung bar rjes su blta bar gnas pa de de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: or if it is to be known by the knowledge of the escape from suffering, the Tathāgata knows it as it really is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brgya'am /🔽bskal pa stong @164b ngam; bskal pa khri'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ba nas bskal pa brgya'am / bskal pa stong @164b ngam; bskal pa khri'am /
translated: “If one were to ask about the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the Tathāgata, the Tathāgata would answer for an eon or for more than an eon.🔽For an eon or for more than an eon,

original: bskal pa bye ba'am /🔽bskal pa ther 'bum mam /
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba'am / bskal pa ther 'bum mam /
translated: for a thousand eons or a hundred thousand eons,🔽for a million eons or a billion eons,

original: bskal pa gtams sam /
analyzed: bskal pa gtams sam /
translated: for a trillion eons or a quintillion eons,

original: bskal pa dkrigs sam /
analyzed: bskal pa dkrigs sam /
translated: for a sextillion eons or a septillion eons,🔽for an octillion eons or a nonillion eons,

original: bskal pa yid yal lam /
analyzed: bskal pa yid yal lam /
translated: the kalpa of the disappearance of the mind,

original: bskal pa khyad phyin nam /
analyzed: bskal pa khyad phyin nam /
translated: the kalpa of the disappearance of the distinctions,

original: bskal pa dpag tu med par lan gsung ngo //
analyzed: bskal pa dpag tu med par lan gsung ngo //
translated: the kalpa of the disappearance of the incalculable,🔽the kalpa of the disappearance of the inconceivable,🔽the kalpa of the disappearance of the incomparable,

original: bskal pa grangs med pa dang / bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / gzhal gyis mi lang bar lan gsung ngo //🔽bskal pa brjod du med par lan gsung ngo //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa dang / bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / gzhal gyis mi lang bar lan gsung ngo // bskal pa brjod du med par lan gsung ngo //
translated: the kalpa of the disappearance of the immeasurable,🔽the kalpa of the disappearance of the inexpressible,

original: bskal pa dpag tu med pa'i yang dpag tu med par lan gsung ste /
analyzed: bskal pa dpag tu med pa'i yang dpag tu med par lan gsung ste /
translated: the kalpa of the disappearance of the infinite,🔽the kalpa of the disappearance of the infinite of the infinite,🔽the kalpa of the disappearance of the incalculable of the incalculable,🔽the kalpa of the disappearance of the inconceivable of the inconceivable,🔽the kalpa of the disappearance of the immeasurable of the immeasurable,

original: bskal pa dpag tu med pa'i grangs med pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i gzhal gyis mi lang ba dang / dpag tu med pa'i yang brjod du med par lan gsung ngo //
analyzed: bskal pa dpag tu med pa'i grangs med pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i gzhal gyis mi lang ba dang / dpag tu med pa'i yang brjod du med par lan gsung ngo //
translated: the kalpa of the disappearance of the inexpressible of the inexpressible.

analyzed: bskal pa dpag tu med pa'i grangs med pa dang / grangs med pa'i grangs med pa dang / grangs med pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / grangs med pa'i gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa'i gzhal gyis mi lang ba dang / grangs med pa'i brjod du med pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i grangs med pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gzhal du med pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gzhal gyis mi lang ba dang / bsam gyis @165a *//
translated: countless eons, countless eons of countless eons, countless eons of inconceivable eons, countless eons of immeasurable eons, countless eons of ineffable eons,🔽inconceivable eons, inconceivable eons of inconceivable eons, inconceivable eons of immeasurable eons, inconceivable eons of ineffable eons,

original: mi khyab pa'i brjod du med pa dang / gzhal du med pa'i dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa'i grangs med pa dang / gzhal du med pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa'i gzhal du med pa dang /
analyzed: mi khyab pa'i brjod du med pa dang / gzhal du med pa'i dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa'i grangs med pa dang / gzhal du med pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa'i gzhal du med pa dang /

original: gzhal du med pa'i gzhal gyis mi lang ba dang / gzhal du med pa'i brjod du med pa dang / gzhal gyis mi lang ba'i dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal gyis mi lang ba'i grangs med pa dang / gzhal gyis mi lang ba'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang /
analyzed: gzhal du med pa'i gzhal gyis mi lang ba dang / gzhal du med pa'i brjod du med pa dang / gzhal gyis mi lang ba'i dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal gyis mi lang ba'i grangs med pa dang / gzhal gyis mi lang ba'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang /
translated: the incalculable, the inexpressible, the immeasurable, the innumerable, the inconceivable,🔽the incalculable, the inexpressible, the immeasurable, the innumerable, the inconceivable,🔽the incalculable, the inexpressible, the immeasurable, the innumerable, the inconceivable,

original: gzhal gyis mi lang ba'i gzhal gyis mi lang ba dang / gzhal gyis mi lang ba'i brjod du med pa dang / brjod du med pa'i dpag tu med pa dang / brjod du med pa'i grangs med pa dang / brjod du med pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang /🔽brjod du med pa'i gzhal du med pa dang / brjod du med pa'i gzhal gyis mi lang ba dang / brjod du med pa'i brjod du med par lan gsung ste /
analyzed: gzhal gyis mi lang ba'i gzhal gyis mi lang ba dang / gzhal gyis mi lang ba'i brjod du med pa dang / brjod du med pa'i dpag tu med pa dang / brjod du med pa'i grangs med pa dang / brjod du med pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / brjod du med pa'i gzhal du med pa dang / brjod du med pa'i gzhal gyis mi lang ba dang / brjod du med pa'i brjod du med par lan gsung ste /
translated: the inexpressible, the incalculable, the immeasurable, the innumerable, and the inexpressible.

original: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
analyzed: de'i spobs pa zad mi shes so //
translated: His eloquence is inexhaustible.”

original: khyim bdag / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Householder, why is that?”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa des chos kyi dbyings bla na med pa mkhyen rab kyis shin tu thugs su chud de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa des chos kyi dbyings bla na med pa mkhyen rab kyis shin tu thugs su chud de /
translated: That thus-gone one has fully understood the unsurpassed realm of phenomena through wisdom.

original: gang thugs su chud pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa @165b de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ste /
analyzed: gang thugs su chud pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa @165b de la'ang zhu ba zhus pa na bskal par lan gsung ste /
translated: If one were to ask him about the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of omniscience that is understood by the thus-gone ones, he would answer for an eon.

original: spobs pa mi zad do //
analyzed: spobs pa mi zad do //
translated: His eloquence would be inexhaustible.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'dir gang gi ye shes mthong ba thogs pa med par 'jug pa de ni /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi ye shes mthong ba thogs pa med par 'jug pa de ni /
translated: the one whose wisdom vision is unobstructed will

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi par 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi par 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: enjoy this sandalwood courtyard and the palace.

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas gnas shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas gnas shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the thus-gone ones know the knowledge of abodes in the following way.

original: 'di lta ste; dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste; dper na /
translated: For example,

original: nam mkha'i bya rjes ji snyed pa nyid ming tsam ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i bya rjes ji snyed pa nyid ming tsam ste /
translated: the tracks of a bird in the sky are simply a name.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas gnas shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas gnas shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: In the same way, the thus-gone ones know that the knowledge of abodes is simply a name.

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas gnas shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas gnas shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, understands as it really is the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the foundation.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, understands as it really is the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the bases as follows:

original: dper na / bud med gzhon nu dag ga rmi lam na bu btsas pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /🔽ming tsam ste /
analyzed: dper na / bud med gzhon nu dag ga rmi lam na bu btsas pa ji snyed pa nyid ni / ming tsam ste /
translated: For example, householder, just as the births of sons in the dreams of young women are mere names,

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas gnas shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //🔽khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas gnas shes pa 'gog pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas gnas shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to // khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas gnas shes pa 'gog pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: in the same way, householder, the Tathāgata understands as it really is that the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the bases is mere names.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, understands as it really is the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the bases as follows:

original: dper na / bud med gzhon nu dag gi rmi lam na bu shi ba ji snyed pa nyid ni /🔽ming tsam ste /🔽de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas gnas shes pa 'gog pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de @166a *//
analyzed: dper na / bud med gzhon nu dag gi rmi lam na bu shi ba ji snyed pa nyid ni / ming tsam ste / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas gnas shes pa 'gog pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de @166a *//
translated: For example, householder, just as the deaths of sons in the dreams of young women are mere names,

original: ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: in the same way, householder, the Tathāgata understands as it really is that the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the bases is mere names.

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas gnas shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas gnas shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata also knows thoroughly the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the abodes.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / bud med gzhon nu dag gi rmi lam na bu'i mya ngan byed pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /🔽ming tsam ste /
analyzed: dper na / bud med gzhon nu dag gi rmi lam na bu'i mya ngan byed pa ji snyed pa nyid ni / ming tsam ste /
translated: Just as the sorrow of a son in the dream of a young woman is merely a name,

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas gnas shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas gnas shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: in the same way, the Tathāgata knows thoroughly that the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the abodes is merely a name.

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata also knows thoroughly the knowledge of the non-abodes.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / nam mkha' la ri mo bris pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dper na / nam mkha' la ri mo bris pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /
translated: It is like this:

original: ming tsam ste /
analyzed: ming tsam ste /
translated: Just as a drawing in the sky is merely a name,

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: in the same way, the Tathāgata knows thoroughly that the knowledge of the non-abodes is merely a name.

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas gnas ma yin pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata’s knowing of the sources of the knowledge of what is the case and what is not the case is as follows:🔽
