original: ming tsam ste /🔽de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas yid kyi las shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: ming tsam ste / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas yid kyi las shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: To that extent, it is merely a name.🔽In the same way, the Tathāgata knows as it really is the knowledge of the activity of mind to that extent it is merely a name.

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas yid kyi las shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas yid kyi las shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the origin of the knowledge of the activity of mind is as follows:

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na ri mo 'bri ba'i bzo shes pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na ri mo 'bri ba'i bzo shes pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /
translated: It is like this:

original: ming tsam ste /🔽de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: ming tsam ste / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: For example, the knowledge of the arts of painting that a magical person has in a dream is simply a name.

original: ming tsam gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: ming tsam gyi bar du'o //
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, is simply a name.

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas yid kyi las shes pa 'gog pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas yid kyi las shes pa 'gog pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, knows as it really is the knowledge of the cessation of the mental activity:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na ri mo 'bri ba'i bskal ba shes pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /🔽ming tsam ste /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na ri mo 'bri ba'i bskal ba shes pa ji snyed pa nyid ni / ming tsam ste /
translated: For example, the knowledge of the eons of painting that a magical person has in a dream is simply a name.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te ming tsam gyi bar du'o //🔽khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs @194a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te ming tsam gyi bar du'o // khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs @194a *//
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, is simply a name.

original: pas yid kyi las shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: pas yid kyi las shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, knows as it really is the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the mental activity:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na slob dpon gyis bstan pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na slob dpon gyis bstan pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /
translated: For example, Householder, the extent of the teachings of the master in the dream of an illusory person is

original: ming tsam ste /
analyzed: ming tsam ste /
translated: merely a name.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas yid kyi las shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas yid kyi las shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Similarly, the Tathāgata knows that the extent of the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of mental activity is merely a name.

original: bam po bcu gcig pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu gcig pa /
translated: Chapter Eleven

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas sngon du 'gro ba shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas sngon du 'gro ba shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata knows the knowledge of what precedes in the following way:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na sngon du mgyogs pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na sngon du mgyogs pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /
translated: the extent of what precedes in the dream of an illusory person is

original: ming tsam ste /
analyzed: ming tsam ste /
translated: merely a name.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas sngon du 'gro ba shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas sngon du 'gro ba shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Similarly, the Tathāgata knows that the extent of the Tathāgata’s knowledge of what precedes is merely a name.

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas sngon du 'gro ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas sngon du 'gro ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata thoroughly knows the origin of the knowledge of the prior limit in this way:

original: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na phyogs dag tu don gyi bsam pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na phyogs dag tu don gyi bsam pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /
translated: For example, a magical person in a dream has as many thoughts of objects in the directions as there are,

original: ming tsam ste /
analyzed: ming tsam ste /
translated: but they are just names.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas sngon du 'gro ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas sngon du 'gro ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Similarly, the Tathāgata thoroughly knows that the knowledge of the prior limit in the knowledge of the origin of the knowledge of the prior limit is just names.

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas @194b sngon du 'gro ba shes pa 'gog pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas @194b sngon du 'gro ba shes pa 'gog pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata thoroughly knows the cessation of the knowledge of the prior limit in this way:

original: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na sngon du mgyogs pa shi ba ji snyed pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na sngon du mgyogs pa shi ba ji snyed pa nyid ni /
translated: For example, a magical person in a dream has as many deaths in the prior limit as there are,🔽but they are just names.

original: ming tsam ste; de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas sngon du 'gro ba shes pa 'gog pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: ming tsam ste; de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas sngon du 'gro ba shes pa 'gog pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: It is just a name. In the same way, the Tathāgata fully knows that the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the past is just a name.

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas sngon du 'gro ba shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas sngon du 'gro ba shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the past is as follows:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is just as

original: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na phyogs dag tu don grub pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam ste /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na phyogs dag tu don grub pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam ste /
translated: the knowledge of the accomplishment of the aims of the various directions by an illusory person in a dream is just a name.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas sngon du 'gro ba shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas sngon du 'gro ba shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata fully knows that the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the past is just a name.

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su 'jug pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su 'jug pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the subsequent knowledge is as follows:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is just as

original: dper na; rmi lam na rnam par sad par byed pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /🔽ming tsam ste /
analyzed: dper na; rmi lam na rnam par sad par byed pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid ni / ming tsam ste /
translated: For example, it is like the fact that the knowledge of waking up in a dream is merely a name.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su 'jug pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su 'jug pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata knows that the knowledge of engaging in the Tathāgata’s knowledge is merely a name.

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su 'jug pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /🔽'di lta ste /🔽dper @195a *// na; sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na rnam par sad pa shes pa nyid ni /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su 'jug pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te / 'di lta ste / dper @195a *// na; sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na rnam par sad pa shes pa nyid ni /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of engaging in the Tathāgata’s knowledge is as follows:

original: ming tsam ste /
analyzed: ming tsam ste /
translated: For example, it is like the fact that the knowledge of waking up in a dream of an illusory person is merely a name.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su 'jug pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su 'jug pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata knows that the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of engaging in the Tathāgata’s knowledge is merely a name.

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su 'jug pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su 'jug pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of engaging in the Tathāgata’s knowledge is as follows:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example, it is like the fact that the knowledge of waking up in a dream of an illusory person is merely a name.

original: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam nam shi ba ji snyed pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam nam shi ba ji snyed pa nyid ni /
translated: For example, it is like the number of deaths in the dream of an illusory person.

original: ming tsam ste /
analyzed: ming tsam ste /
translated: For example, Home Minister, the death of an illusory person in a dream is just a name.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su 'jug pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su 'jug pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata knows that the cessation of the knowledge of the subsequent engagement of the Tathāgata is just a name.

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su 'jug pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su 'jug pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata knows as it really is the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the subsequent engagement of the Tathāgata.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na mi mthun pa'i rtsa ba yang dag par gcod pa ni ming tsam ste /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na mi mthun pa'i rtsa ba yang dag par gcod pa ni ming tsam ste /
translated: For example, Home Minister, the cutting off of the root of conflict in the dream of an illusory person is just a name.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te ming tsam gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te ming tsam gyi bar du'o //
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata knows that the cutting off of the root of conflict in the subsequent engagement of the Tathāgata is just a name.

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mi nyams pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mi nyams pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata knows as it really is the knowledge of non-decline.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na dug 'thungs pa'i rtsi sman ma lus par byed pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na dug 'thungs pa'i rtsi sman ma lus par byed pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /
translated: For example, Householder, it is like the case of a magician creating an illusory person, and then that illusory person taking poison in a dream and searching for a medicine to counteract the poison.

original: ming tsam ste /
analyzed: ming tsam ste /
translated: The extent of that is merely nominal.

original: @195b de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mi nyams pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: @195b de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mi nyams pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata knows as it really is the extent of the knowledge of the non-decaying as merely nominal.

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mi nyams pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mi nyams pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Householder, regarding this, the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the non-decaying is as follows:

original: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na dug byin pa la dug bsal ba tshol ba ji snyed pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na dug byin pa la dug bsal ba tshol ba ji snyed pa nyid ni /
translated: For example, Householder, it is like the case of a magician creating an illusory person, and then that illusory person taking poison in a dream and searching for a medicine to counteract the poison.

original: ming tsam ste /
analyzed: ming tsam ste /
translated: The extent of that is merely nominal.🔽In the same way, the Tathāgata knows as it really is the extent of the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of the non-decaying as merely nominal.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mi nyams pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to; ;khyim bdag /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mi nyams pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to; ;khyim bdag /
translated: “Householder, regarding this, the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of the non-decaying is as follows:

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mi nyams pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mi nyams pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: The Tathāgata fully knows the cessation of the knowledge of the absence of complete degeneration.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na dug yang mi 'byung ba ji snyed pa nyid ni /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na dug yang mi 'byung ba ji snyed pa nyid ni /
translated: It is like this:

original: ming tsam ste /
analyzed: ming tsam ste /
translated: for example, the poison that does not arise in a dream of an illusory person is simply a name.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mi nyams pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mi nyams pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Similarly, the Tathāgata fully knows that the cessation of the knowledge of the absence of complete degeneration is simply a name.

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mi nyams pa shes pa 'gog pa shes par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mi nyams pa shes pa 'gog pa shes par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, the Tathāgata fully knows the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the absence of complete degeneration.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na dug byin pa la yang dag par gso ba'i dpyad byed pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na dug byin pa la yang dag par gso ba'i dpyad byed pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /
translated: It is like this:

original: ming tsam ste /
analyzed: ming tsam ste /
translated: for example, the medical treatment for the poison given in a dream of an illusory person is simply a name.

original: de bzhin @196a *//
analyzed: de bzhin @196a *//
translated: Similarly, the Tathāgata fully knows that the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of the absence of complete degeneration is simply a name.

original: du de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mi nyams pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to; ;khyim bdag /
analyzed: du de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mi nyams pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to; ;khyim bdag /
translated: The Tathagata knows that the knowledge of the path to the cessation of the knowledge of non-decline of the Tathagata is also just a name.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te / 'di lta ste /
translated: Householder, the Tathagata knows this knowledge of omniscience thus:

original: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na rtsi sman mkhan nad la mkhas pa dang / nad kun nas ldang ba la mkhas pa dang / nad pa'i khams la mkhas pa dang / sman sbyor ba la mkhas pa dang / kha zas kyi cho ga la mkhas ba dang /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na rtsi sman mkhan nad la mkhas pa dang / nad kun nas ldang ba la mkhas pa dang / nad pa'i khams la mkhas pa dang / sman sbyor ba la mkhas pa dang / kha zas kyi cho ga la mkhas ba dang /
translated: For example, it is like a magician who is skilled in medicine in a dream, skilled in the origin of illness, skilled in the elements of the sick, skilled in compounding medicine, skilled in the ritual of food,

original: khrus kyi cho ga la mkhas pa dang / sku mnye'i cho ga la mkhas pa dang // rkang pa mnye ba'i cho ga la mkhas pa dang / lag pas mnye ba'i cho ga la mkhas pa dang / nyal ba'i cho ga la mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: khrus kyi cho ga la mkhas pa dang / sku mnye'i cho ga la mkhas pa dang // rkang pa mnye ba'i cho ga la mkhas pa dang / lag pas mnye ba'i cho ga la mkhas pa dang / nyal ba'i cho ga la mkhas pa dang /
translated: skilled in the ritual of bathing, skilled in the ritual of massage, skilled in the ritual of foot massage, skilled in the ritual of hand massage, skilled in the ritual of lying down,

original: sad pa'i cho ga la mkhas pa dang / longs spyod kyi cho ga la mkhas pa dang / dpyad kyi sbyor ba 'dug pa la mkhas pa dang / dus shes /
analyzed: sad pa'i cho ga la mkhas pa dang / longs spyod kyi cho ga la mkhas pa dang / dpyad kyi sbyor ba 'dug pa la mkhas pa dang / dus shes /
translated: They are skilled in the rites of waking up, skilled in the rites of enjoyment, skilled in the rites of analysis and union, and skilled in knowing the time.🔽

original: tshod shes / dus min shes shing sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na rtsi sman dag gis nad thams cad 'joms pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /
analyzed: tshod shes / dus min shes shing sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na rtsi sman dag gis nad thams cad 'joms pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /
translated: They are skilled in the rites of awakening, skilled in the rites of enjoyment, skilled in the application of analysis, and skilled in the application of non-analysis. They know the right time, the right measure, and the wrong time.

original: ming tsam ste /
analyzed: ming tsam ste /
translated: All of this is merely nominal.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: In the same way, the Thus-Gone One fully knows that all the knowledge of omniscience is merely nominal.

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa @196b shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa @196b shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Householder, the Thus-Gone One fully knows the knowledge of the arising of omniscience as follows:

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na sprul ba'i gso ba'i dpyad shes pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na sprul ba'i gso ba'i dpyad shes pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /
translated: It is like this:

original: ming tsam ste /
analyzed: ming tsam ste /
translated: For example, the knowledge of medical diagnosis of an illusory person in a dream is merely nominal.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Likewise, the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the arising of omniscience is just a name.

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the cessation of omniscience is as follows:

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid ni /
translated: It is like this:

original: ming tsam ste /
analyzed: ming tsam ste /
translated: For example, the knowledge of the complete pacification of all illnesses in a dream of an illusory person is just a name.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog pa shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Likewise, the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the cessation of omniscience is just a name.

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te; 'di lta ste /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa 'di ltar rab tu mkhyen te; 'di lta ste /
translated: “Householder, the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of omniscience is as follows:

original: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na gso ba'i dpyad ji snyed pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i rmi lam na gso ba'i dpyad ji snyed pa nyid ni /
translated: the number of medical treatments for an illusory person in a dream

original: ming tsam ste /
analyzed: ming tsam ste /
translated: is just a name.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa ji snyed pa nyid kyang ming tsam du de ltar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata knows that the number of the Tathāgata’s knowledges of the paths that are the cessation of the knowledges of all topics is just a name.

original: khyim bdag / de lta bas na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de lta bas na /
translated: Householder, in that case,

original: 'dir gang gi ye shes mthong ba thogs @197a *//
analyzed: 'dir gang gi ye shes mthong ba thogs @197a *//
translated: here, the one whose knowledge-vision is unobstructedly engaged,

original: pa med par 'jug pa gzhan gyis ma bstan cing /
analyzed: pa med par 'jug pa gzhan gyis ma bstan cing /
translated: who is not taught by another,

original: gzhan la rag ma las pa'i shes pas sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i don du bdag nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de ni /
analyzed: gzhan la rag ma las pa'i shes pas sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i don du bdag nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de ni /
translated: who benefits sentient beings with knowledge that does not depend on another, who has fully awakened on his own,

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi bar 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: will enjoy this place, from the sandalwood courtyard up to the fine mansion.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyis lag gi bla tshe dang ldan pa gang po la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyis lag gi bla tshe dang ldan pa gang po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this was said, the householder Vyantara said to the venerable Pūrṇa:

original: gang po / bcom ldan 'das de da ltar gang na bzhugs /
analyzed: gang po / bcom ldan 'das de da ltar gang na bzhugs /
translated: Pūrṇa, where is the Blessed One now?

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / lag gi bla gang pos khyim bdag phyva mkhan la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / lag gi bla gang pos khyim bdag phyva mkhan la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this was said, the venerable Pūrṇa replied to the householder Vāstuvāna:

original: khyim bdag / byang phyogs logs na ko sa la zhes bya ba'i yul gyi ljongs yod de /
analyzed: khyim bdag / byang phyogs logs na ko sa la zhes bya ba'i yul gyi ljongs yod de /
translated: “Householder, in the northern direction there is a country called Kāśī.

original: gangs ri'i rgyal po'i drung na mnyan yod ces bya ba grong khyer chen po de na rgyal po'i bu gzhon nu rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bcom ldan 'das de da ltar bzhugs so //
analyzed: gangs ri'i rgyal po'i drung na mnyan yod ces bya ba grong khyer chen po de na rgyal po'i bu gzhon nu rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bcom ldan 'das de da ltar bzhugs so //
translated: In the great city of Śrāvastī at the foot of the king of snow mountains, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada, the Blessed One is now residing.”

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyis lag gi bla tshe dang ldan pa gang po la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyis lag gi bla tshe dang ldan pa gang po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this was said, the householder Vāstuvāna said to the venerable Pūrṇa:

original: gang po / mnyan yod kyi grong khyer chen po 'di nas ring khyad ci tsam /
analyzed: gang po / mnyan yod kyi grong khyer chen po 'di nas ring khyad ci tsam /
translated: “Pūrṇa, how far is it from this great city of Śrāvastī?”

original: smras pa / khyim bdag /
analyzed: smras pa / khyim bdag /
translated: He replied, “Householder,

original: de dpag tshad sum stong drug cu rtsa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: de dpag tshad sum stong drug cu rtsa bzhi yod do //
translated: It is 3,640 yojanas in size.

original: de skad ces ces smras pa dang / khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyis @197b lag gi bla tshe dang ldan pa gang po la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces ces smras pa dang / khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyis @197b lag gi bla tshe dang ldan pa gang po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When he had said this, the householder Vyantara said to the venerable Pūrṇa:

original: gang po / ring ba de nas bcom ldan 'das de ji srid cig gis 'dir byon /
analyzed: gang po / ring ba de nas bcom ldan 'das de ji srid cig gis 'dir byon /
translated: “Pūrṇa, how long will it be before the Blessed One arrives from that faraway place?”

original: smras pa / khyim bdag /
analyzed: smras pa / khyim bdag /
translated: Pūrṇa replied, “Householder,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni; ring ba'am nye ba med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni; ring ba'am nye ba med de /
translated: the Thus-Gone One is neither far away nor near.

original: khyim bdag / bcom ldan 'das de bzhed na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / bcom ldan 'das de bzhed na /
translated: Householder, if the Blessed One wishes,

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir grangs med pa'i gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed las lhag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams khrag khrig dag tu gshegs so //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir grangs med pa'i gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed las lhag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams khrag khrig dag tu gshegs so //
translated: he can travel to many hundreds of thousands of world systems, more numerous than the sands of the Ganges, in order to ripen beings.

original: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa dag mkhyen /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de la de bzhin gshegs pas sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa dag mkhyen /
translated: Householder, in this regard, the Thus-Gone One knows the minds and conduct of all beings.

original: shin tu mkhyen /
analyzed: shin tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows them well.

original: shin tu gzigs /🔽shin tu thugs su chud /
analyzed: shin tu gzigs / shin tu thugs su chud /
translated: He sees them well.🔽He understands them well.

original: shin tu mngon sum du mdzad de /
analyzed: shin tu mngon sum du mdzad de /
translated: He realizes them well.

original: mig btsums pa tsam gyis sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa dag rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: mig btsums pa tsam gyis sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa dag rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: By merely closing his eyes, he knows the minds and actions of all sentient beings.

original: khyim bdag / de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhed na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhed na /
translated: Householder, if the Tathāgata wishes to,

original: sems can thams cad la phan gdags pa'i blo nye bar bzhag nas 'jig rten gyi khams khrag khrig dag tu gshegs so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan gdags pa'i blo nye bar bzhag nas 'jig rten gyi khams khrag khrig dag tu gshegs so //
translated: having set his mind on benefiting all sentient beings, he goes to a hundred billion world systems.

original: gang po / bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su gzung ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa de zhal zas bzang po la nye bar spyan drangs na gshegs sam /
analyzed: gang po / bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su gzung ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa de zhal zas bzang po la nye bar spyan drangs na gshegs sam /
translated: Pūrṇa, if you invite that Tathāgata to a good meal for the sake of taking up your roots of virtue, will he come?

original: khyim bdag / gal te cung zad yongs su gtong ba lta na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / gal te cung zad yongs su gtong ba lta na /
translated: Householder, if you give something away,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de zhal zas gtsang ma la spyan drongs shig dang / khyod kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su gzung ba'i phyir @198a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de zhal zas gtsang ma la spyan drongs shig dang / khyod kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su gzung ba'i phyir @198a *//
translated: invite that Tathāgata to a pure meal, and for the sake of taking up your roots of virtue

original: bcom ldan 'das de nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas par gshegs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas par gshegs so //
translated: that Blessed One will come with his community of disciples.”

original: de nas khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyi tshe dang ldan pa gang po'i ltar mnyan nas me tog dang / phreng ba dang / bdug pa dag blangs te tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi steng du 'dzegs nas me tog gis brgyan /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyi tshe dang ldan pa gang po'i ltar mnyan nas me tog dang / phreng ba dang / bdug pa dag blangs te tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang gi steng du 'dzegs nas me tog gis brgyan /
translated: Then the householder, the master builder, having listened to the venerable Pūrṇa, took flowers, garlands, and incense, and ascended to the top of the sandalwood terrace and the fine house, adorned with flowers,

original: spos kyis byugs nas bcom ldan 'das de phyogs gang logs na bzhugs par de phyogs nas gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar te pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas thal mo sbyar te 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: spos kyis byugs nas bcom ldan 'das de phyogs gang logs na bzhugs par de phyogs nas gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar te pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas thal mo sbyar te 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: anointed with incense, and from the direction where the Blessed One was staying, he bared one shoulder, knelt on his right knee, joined his palms, and said this:

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag la thugs brtse ba nye bar dgongs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag la thugs brtse ba nye bar dgongs te /
translated: Blessed One, please consider me with compassion.

original: zhal zas bzang po la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu gshegs par ci gnang /
analyzed: zhal zas bzang po la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu gshegs par ci gnang /
translated: Please allow the Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Buddha, together with the Saṅgha of monks, to come and partake of excellent food.

original: bcom ldan 'das rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal na bzhugs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal na bzhugs pa /
translated: The Blessed One is staying in the Jeta Grove,

original: mi las 'das pa /
analyzed: mi las 'das pa /
translated: beyond human status,

original: lha'i snyan rnam par dag pas khams kyi khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyi spyan drangs pa gsan nas gshegs par gnang ngo //
analyzed: lha'i snyan rnam par dag pas khams kyi khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyi spyan drangs pa gsan nas gshegs par gnang ngo //
translated: The pure divine hearing of the Blessed One heard the invitation of the householder architect of the realm, and he assented to go.

original: de nas khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyis bcom ldan 'das mngon par spyan drangs te /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyis bcom ldan 'das mngon par spyan drangs te /
translated: Then the householder architect invited the Blessed One,

original: bran dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dang / mdza' bshes dang / nye du dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: bran dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dang / mdza' bshes dang / nye du dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: and he said to his servants, workers, day laborers, friends, relatives, and kinsmen,

original: khyed cag nyon cig @198b ngas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas par zhal zas bzang po la spyan drangs kyi /
analyzed: khyed cag nyon cig @198b ngas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas par zhal zas bzang po la spyan drangs kyi /
translated: “Listen, all of you! I have invited the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, together with the community of his disciples, to a fine meal.

original: de la khyed nus pa ci yod pa dang / mthu ci yod pa'i lus kyis zhal ta bya ba la brtson pa dang ldan par gyis shig /
analyzed: de la khyed nus pa ci yod pa dang / mthu ci yod pa'i lus kyis zhal ta bya ba la brtson pa dang ldan par gyis shig /
translated: With whatever ability and strength you have, you should be diligent in your service to him.”

original: khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyis de skad ces smras pa dang / mdza' bshes dang / nye du dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams dang / bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dag gis khyim bdag phyva mkhan la 'di skad ces smras so //🔽khyim bdag / smyos so //
analyzed: khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyis de skad ces smras pa dang / mdza' bshes dang / nye du dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams dang / bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dag gis khyim bdag phyva mkhan la 'di skad ces smras so // khyim bdag / smyos so //
translated: relatives, blood relatives, male and female servants, workers, and employees said to the householder Kūṭadanta,🔽“Householder, you are mad!

original: khyim bdag / g-yengs so //
analyzed: khyim bdag / g-yengs so //
translated: Householder, you are confused!

original: gang bcom ldan 'das de ma mthong bar zhal zas bzang po la spyan 'dren tam /
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das de ma mthong bar zhal zas bzang po la spyan 'dren tam /
translated: How can you invite the Blessed One to a meal of fine food without having seen him?

original: khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyis bcom ldan 'das de spyan 'dren to zhes su gsol /
analyzed: khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyis bcom ldan 'das de spyan 'dren to zhes su gsol /
translated: Who says that the Blessed One is invited by the householder Kūṭadanta?”

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyis mdza' bshes dang / blon po dang / nye du dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams dang / bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyis mdza' bshes dang / blon po dang / nye du dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams dang / bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When they said this, the householder Kūṭadanta said to his friends, ministers, relatives, blood relatives, male and female servants, workers, and employees,

original: grogs po dag /
analyzed: grogs po dag /
translated: “Friends,

original: bcom ldan 'das de sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dpag tu med pa dag pa brnyes te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dpag tu med pa dag pa brnyes te /
translated: The Blessed One has attained the immeasurable, pure qualities of a buddha.

original: des nga'i sems mkhyen nas gnang ngo //
analyzed: des nga'i sems mkhyen nas gnang ngo //
translated: He knows my mind and has given his permission.”

original: de dag mgu zhing dga' la yid rangs pa dang / rab tu dga' zhing @199a *//
analyzed: de dag mgu zhing dga' la yid rangs pa dang / rab tu dga' zhing @199a *//
translated: They were delighted, joyful, elated,🔽happy, and content. They prepared a great deal of excellent food and drink for the night.

original: bde ba dang / yid bde ba skyes nas de'i mtshan mo bza' ba dang / bca' ba bzang zhing rab tu mang po mngon par yang dag par byas so; ;de nas bcom ldan 'das de phyem red kyi dus su nang du yang dag 'jog las bzhengs nas smyig ma'i ldum bu'i 'khor gyi khyams ga la ba der gshegs so //
analyzed: bde ba dang / yid bde ba skyes nas de'i mtshan mo bza' ba dang / bca' ba bzang zhing rab tu mang po mngon par yang dag par byas so; ;de nas bcom ldan 'das de phyem red kyi dus su nang du yang dag 'jog las bzhengs nas smyig ma'i ldum bu'i 'khor gyi khyams ga la ba der gshegs so //
translated: Then, in the morning, the Blessed One rose from his inner composure and went to the grove of sugarcane.

original: de'i tshe smyig ma'i ldum bu'i 'khor gyi khyams na tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dang / dge slong rab tu mang po dag dang lhan cig 'dus nas 'khod par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshe smyig ma'i ldum bu'i 'khor gyi khyams na tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dang / dge slong rab tu mang po dag dang lhan cig 'dus nas 'khod par gyur to //
translated: At that time, the venerable Ānanda and many other monks had gathered and were sitting together in the grove of sugarcane.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda,

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ananda,

original: song la mnyan yod kyi grong khyer chen po na dge slong nye bar gnas shing 'khod pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad rim gro'i gnas su 'dus nas nga la sbron cig /
analyzed: song la mnyan yod kyi grong khyer chen po na dge slong nye bar gnas shing 'khod pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad rim gro'i gnas su 'dus nas nga la sbron cig /
translated: go to the great city of Shravasti and tell all the monks who are staying there to gather in the assembly hall.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos de ltar 'tshal zhes bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar mnyan nas mnyan yod kyi grong khyer chen po na dge slong nye bar gnas shing 'khod pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad rim gro'i gnas su 'dus nas bcom ldan 'das ga🔽la bzhugs pa der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos de ltar 'tshal zhes bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar mnyan nas mnyan yod kyi grong khyer chen po na dge slong nye bar gnas shing 'khod pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad rim gro'i gnas su 'dus nas bcom ldan 'das ga la bzhugs pa der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: The Venerable Ananda replied, Yes, sir, and went to the great city of Shravasti, where he told all the monks who were staying there to gather in the assembly hall.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: When they had all assembled, he went to the Buddha, and said, Lord,

original: mnyan yod kyi grong khyer chen po na dge @199b slong nye bar gnas shing mchis pa de dag thams cad rim gro'i gnas su 'dus lags te /
analyzed: mnyan yod kyi grong khyer chen po na dge @199b slong nye bar gnas shing mchis pa de dag thams cad rim gro'i gnas su 'dus lags te /
translated: all the monks who are staying in the great city of Shravasti have assembled in the assembly hall.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: de'i dus la da bab lags so //
analyzed: de'i dus la da bab lags so //
translated: now is the time to do as you think best.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rim gro'i gnas ga la ba der gshegs nas gdan bcas pa de la bzhugs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rim gro'i gnas ga la ba der gshegs nas gdan bcas pa de la bzhugs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One went to the place where the service was being held and sat down on the seat prepared for him.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong de dag la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong de dag la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to those monks:

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,🔽in the great city of Śubhapāraṃgama, the householder Pāyāsi has invited the Buddha, the community of monks,

original: grong khyer chen po dge ba'i pha rol 'gro na khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyis sangs rgyas dang dge slong gi dge 'dun la sogs pa mngon par spyan drangs te /
analyzed: grong khyer chen po dge ba'i pha rol 'gro na khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyis sangs rgyas dang dge slong gi dge 'dun la sogs pa mngon par spyan drangs te /
translated: and so forth.

original: de ngas gnang gi /
analyzed: de ngas gnang gi /
translated: I have given my consent.

original: de'i phyir dge slong gang dag rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa de dag gis tshul shing longs shig /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong gang dag rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa de dag gis tshul shing longs shig /
translated: Therefore, those monks who possess miraculous powers should take up the voting sticks.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong lnga brgya'i dge slong gi dge 'dun gang dag gis tshul shing blangs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong lnga brgya'i dge slong gi dge 'dun gang dag gis tshul shing blangs so //
translated: At that time, the five hundred monks of the community of monks took up the voting sticks.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi dge slong dag la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi dge slong dag la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the monks:

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi 'phrul ba rnam pa sna tshogs dag gis sems can dag yang dag par dga' bar bya ba'i phyir nam mkha'i lam las 'dong bar gyis shig /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi 'phrul ba rnam pa sna tshogs dag gis sems can dag yang dag par dga' bar bya ba'i phyir nam mkha'i lam las 'dong bar gyis shig /
translated: You should go through the sky by various kinds of miraculous displays in order to delight sentient beings.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: legs so // zhes gsol te /
analyzed: legs so // zhes gsol te /
translated: it is excellent!”

original: dge slong de dag bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar mnyan to //
analyzed: dge slong de dag bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar mnyan to //
translated: Those monks listened to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de'i mtshan mo 'das nas nang bar sngar smad g-yogs dang / chos gos gsol /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de'i mtshan mo 'das nas nang bar sngar smad g-yogs dang / chos gos gsol /
translated: Then, after the night had passed, the Blessed One put on his lower and upper robes,

original: lhung bzed bsnams te rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal nas nam mkha' la mngon @200a *//
analyzed: lhung bzed bsnams te rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal nas nam mkha' la mngon @200a *//
translated: took his alms bowl, and rose up into the sky from the garden of Prince Jeta.

original: par 'phags te grong khyer chen po dge ba'i pha rol 'gro ga la ba der gshegs so //
analyzed: par 'phags te grong khyer chen po dge ba'i pha rol 'gro ga la ba der gshegs so //
translated: He went to the great city of Śubhapāra.🔽The venerable Kāśyapa was living on the side of Sage Mountain in Rājagṛha,

original: tshe dang ldan pa shing shun can rgyal po'i khab na drang srong gi ri ngos la spa dang / shing pi pa la skye ba na 'dug la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa shing shun can rgyal po'i khab na drang srong gi ri ngos la spa dang / shing pi pa la skye ba na 'dug la /
translated: born from a pīlu tree.🔽In the first and last parts of the night, he was diligent in yoga,

original: nam gyi cha stod dang / cha smad la mi nyal bar rnal 'byor la brtson te /
analyzed: nam gyi cha stod dang / cha smad la mi nyal bar rnal 'byor la brtson te /
translated: not sleeping.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dag sgom pa'i rnal 'byor la rjes su brtson zhing /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dag sgom pa'i rnal 'byor la rjes su brtson zhing /
translated: He was diligently practicing the yoga of cultivating the thirty-seven aspects of the path to enlightenment.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la mngon par brtson pa 'chag cing 'gro ba des bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu nam mkha'i lam nas gshegs pa mthong ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la mngon par brtson pa 'chag cing 'gro ba des bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu nam mkha'i lam nas gshegs pa mthong ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: As he was walking along, diligently practicing śamatha and vipaśyanā, he saw the Blessed One traveling through the sky together with the saṅgha of hearers.🔽He saw the Blessed One🔽like the king of geese.

original: dper na / ngang pa'i rgyal po ltar mthong nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal zhing 'dug go /
analyzed: dper na / ngang pa'i rgyal po ltar mthong nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal zhing 'dug go /
translated: He bowed down to the Blessed One with palms joined and paid homage to him.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa shing shun can la bka' stsal pa //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa shing shun can la bka' stsal pa //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Kaṭhina,

original: shing shun can tshur shog /
analyzed: shing shun can tshur shog /
translated: “Kaṭhina, come here!”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa shing shun can bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal par rig nas lus dang srog la ma bltas par ngam grog dang g-yang sa de la bdag nyid mchongs so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa shing shun can bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal par rig nas lus dang srog la ma bltas par ngam grog dang g-yang sa de la bdag nyid mchongs so //
translated: The Venerable Jyotiṣka, understanding the Blessed One’s words, disregarded his body and life and jumped into the abyss.

original: de bar snang la song ma thag tu mngon par shes pa drug mngon sum du byas par gyur to //
analyzed: de bar snang la song ma thag tu mngon par shes pa drug mngon sum du byas par gyur to //
translated: As soon as he did so, he actualized the six superknowledges.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das dang / shing shun can dang / dgra bcom pa lnga brgya @200b tshang bar thabs cig tu grong khyer chen po dge ba'i pha rol 'gro ga la ba der gshegs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das dang / shing shun can dang / dgra bcom pa lnga brgya @200b tshang bar thabs cig tu grong khyer chen po dge ba'i pha rol 'gro ga la ba der gshegs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One, together with Jyotiṣka and the full complement of five hundred arhats, went to the great city of Śubhapāra.

original: de nas dge slong de dag rdzu 'phrul gyi 'phrul pa rnam pa sna tshogs dag gis tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang der mngon par zhugs te /🔽la la ni /
analyzed: de nas dge slong de dag rdzu 'phrul gyi 'phrul pa rnam pa sna tshogs dag gis tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang der mngon par zhugs te / la la ni /
translated: There the monks entered the sandalwood forest and the fine mansion by means of various miraculous feats.

original: sengge'i gzugs / la la ni /🔽stag gi gzugs /🔽la la ni /
analyzed: sengge'i gzugs / la la ni / stag gi gzugs / la la ni /
translated: Some assumed the form of lions,🔽some the form of tigers,

original: glang po che'i gzugs /🔽la la ni /🔽rta'i gzugs / la la ni /
analyzed: glang po che'i gzugs / la la ni / rta'i gzugs / la la ni /
translated: some the form of elephants,🔽some the form of horses,

original: khyu mchog gi gzugs /
analyzed: khyu mchog gi gzugs /
translated: and some the form of bulls.

original: la la ni /
analyzed: la la ni /
translated: Some say:🔽

original: klu'i gzugs / la la ni /🔽nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po'i gzugs /
analyzed: klu'i gzugs / la la ni / nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po'i gzugs /
translated: some in the form of nāgas,

analyzed: la la ni / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i gzugs / la la ni; blon po'i gzugs /
translated: some in the form of garuḍa kings,🔽some in the form of cakravartin kings,

original: la la ni /🔽dge slong rang gi gzugs /
analyzed: la la ni / dge slong rang gi gzugs /
translated: some in the form of ministers,

original: la la ni /🔽lus las 'od sngon po dag rab tu 'byin /
analyzed: la la ni / lus las 'od sngon po dag rab tu 'byin /
translated: some in the form of bhikṣus,

original: la la ni /
analyzed: la la ni /
translated: some emitting blue light from their bodies,

original: dmar po dang / la la ni /
analyzed: dmar po dang / la la ni /
translated: some red,

original: dkar po dang / la la ni /🔽lus las 'od btsong kha dag rab tu 'byin /
analyzed: dkar po dang / la la ni / lus las 'od btsong kha dag rab tu 'byin /
translated: some white,

original: la la ni /
analyzed: la la ni /
translated: some emitting yellow light from their bodies,

original: char 'bebs / la la ni /🔽rlung rab tu gtong /
analyzed: char 'bebs / la la ni / rlung rab tu gtong /
translated: some bringing rain,

original: la la ni /🔽nor gyi char rab tu 'bebs /
analyzed: la la ni / nor gyi char rab tu 'bebs /
translated: some bringing wind,

original: la la ni /🔽gser gyi char rab tu 'bebs /🔽la la ni /
analyzed: la la ni / gser gyi char rab tu 'bebs / la la ni /
translated: some bringing a rain of wealth,🔽some bringing a rain of gold,

original: dngul gyi char rab tu 'bebs /🔽la la ni /
analyzed: dngul gyi char rab tu 'bebs / la la ni /
translated: some bringing a rain of silver,

original: spos chu'i char rab tu 'bebs /🔽la la ni /
analyzed: spos chu'i char rab tu 'bebs / la la ni /
translated: some bringing a rain of perfumed water,

original: ser bu bsil ba rab tu gtong /🔽la la ni /
analyzed: ser bu bsil ba rab tu gtong / la la ni /
translated: some bringing cool breezes,

original: phrag pa las khyer; la la ni /
analyzed: phrag pa las khyer; la la ni /
translated: some carrying on their shoulders,

original: rgya mtsho chen por chu 'bebs pa khyer /🔽la la ni /🔽shing rta la zhon /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen por chu 'bebs pa khyer / la la ni / shing rta la zhon /
translated: some carrying the great ocean,🔽some riding in chariots,

original: la la ni /
analyzed: la la ni /
translated: some riding in palanquins,

original: glang po che'i shing rta la zhon /
analyzed: glang po che'i shing rta la zhon /
translated: some were riding on elephant-drawn carriages,

original: la la ni /
analyzed: la la ni /
translated: some were riding on

original: rta'i shing rta la zhon /
analyzed: rta'i shing rta la zhon /

original: la las ni /
analyzed: la las ni /
translated: some were riding on

original: @201a *// klu'i shing rta mngon par sprul /
analyzed: @201a *// klu'i shing rta mngon par sprul /
translated: dragon-drawn carriages,

original: la las ni /
analyzed: la las ni /
translated: some were riding on

original: grul bum gyi shing rta mngon par sprul /
analyzed: grul bum gyi shing rta mngon par sprul /
translated: kumbhāṇḍa-drawn carriages,

original: la las ni /
analyzed: la las ni /
translated: some were riding on

original: gnod sbyin gyi shing rta mngon par sprul /
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi shing rta mngon par sprul /
translated: yakṣa-drawn carriages,

original: la las ni /
analyzed: la las ni /
translated: some were riding on

original: dri za'i shing rta mngon par sprul /
analyzed: dri za'i shing rta mngon par sprul /
translated: gandharva-drawn carriages,

original: la las ni /
analyzed: la las ni /
translated: some were riding on

original: cho 'phrul dag zung du sprul /🔽la las ni /
analyzed: cho 'phrul dag zung du sprul / la las ni /
translated: double-miracle-drawn carriages,

original: bdag gi lus las me spar /🔽la las ni /
analyzed: bdag gi lus las me spar / la las ni /
translated: some were emitting fire from their bodies,

original: bdag gi lus las chu 'dzag ste /
analyzed: bdag gi lus las chu 'dzag ste /
translated: some were emitting water from their bodies,

original: de dag la sogs pa cho 'phrul gyi 'phrul pa rnam pa sna tshogs gzhan dag gis kyang tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang du mngon par zhugs so //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa cho 'phrul gyi 'phrul pa rnam pa sna tshogs gzhan dag gis kyang tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang du mngon par zhugs so //
translated: and so forth. They entered the sandalwood forest and the fine mansion with various other miraculous displays.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni /
translated: The Blessed One🔽was adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being,

original: bdag nyid kyi dngos po bzung bas skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis ni /🔽yang dag par brgyan /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi dngos po bzung bas skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis ni / yang dag par brgyan /
translated: which he had taken on himself,

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus ni /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus ni /
translated: and with the eighty minor marks.

original: rnam par spras /
analyzed: rnam par spras /
translated: adorned,

original: mdzes shing dang ba dang; dbang po ni /
analyzed: mdzes shing dang ba dang; dbang po ni /
translated: beautiful, clear, and with senses🔽calm,

original: zhi / thugs ni /🔽zhi / dul ba dang / zhi gnas dam pa ni /
analyzed: zhi / thugs ni / zhi / dul ba dang / zhi gnas dam pa ni /
translated: peaceful,🔽and having attained the highest tranquility,

original: brnyes / dul ba dang zhi gnas mchog gi pha rol tu phyin /
analyzed: brnyes / dul ba dang zhi gnas mchog gi pha rol tu phyin /
translated: he had perfected discipline and tranquility.

original: mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa dang; lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu stong dag gis ni /
analyzed: mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa dang; lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu stong dag gis ni /
translated: Brahmā, lord of the Sahā world, Śakra, lord of the gods, the four great kings, and a thousand gods from the pure realms

original: phyag byas / bdud rtsi'i char gyi rgyun rab tu 'bebs shing mchod pa dang / me tog mand'a ra ba'i char 'bebs shing /
analyzed: phyag byas / bdud rtsi'i char gyi rgyun rab tu 'bebs shing mchod pa dang / me tog mand'a ra ba'i char 'bebs shing /
translated: made offerings to him, raining down a stream of nectar and a rain of coral tree flowers.

original: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang du mngon par gshegs te /
analyzed: tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang du mngon par gshegs te /
translated: He then entered the sandalwood grove and the fine mansion.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: bcom ldan 'das @201b nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu sems can dag yang dag par dga' bar mdzad cing tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang du mngon par gshegs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @201b nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu sems can dag yang dag par dga' bar mdzad cing tsandan gyi khyams dang / khang bzang du mngon par gshegs so //
translated: the Blessed One, together with the saṅgha of hearers, entered the sandalwood grove and the fine mansion to delight the beings there.

original: dge ba'i pha rol 'gro'i bram ze dang / khyim bdag gis bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu bar snang las gshegs pa mthong ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i pha rol 'gro'i bram ze dang / khyim bdag gis bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu bar snang las gshegs pa mthong ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: They saw him

original: dper na / ngang pa'i rgyal po chen po lta bur mthong nas srog chags khri dag chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral te rnam par dag go /
analyzed: dper na / ngang pa'i rgyal po chen po lta bur mthong nas srog chags khri dag chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral te rnam par dag go /
translated: like the great king of geese. Ten thousand beings became free of dust and stains, and their Dharma eyes were purified with regard to phenomena.

original: gang dag sngon gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la spyad pa'i srog chags khri dag gis ni /
analyzed: gang dag sngon gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la spyad pa'i srog chags khri dag gis ni /
translated: Ten thousand beings who had practiced under the blessed buddhas of the past

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul mthong nas byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul mthong nas byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
translated: saw the Blessed One’s miraculous display and gave rise to the mind set on awakening.

original: de dag byang chub tu sems bskyed ma thag tu mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob bo //
analyzed: de dag byang chub tu sems bskyed ma thag tu mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob bo //
translated: As soon as they gave rise to the mind set on awakening, they attained the acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced.

original: sngon sems ma bskyed pa'i srog chags khri dag gis ni /
analyzed: sngon sems ma bskyed pa'i srog chags khri dag gis ni /
translated: Ten thousand beings who had not previously given rise to the mind set on awakening

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: gave rise to the mind set on awakening.

original: nyan thos dag gis 'dul ba'i srog chags brgyad khri dag ni /
analyzed: nyan thos dag gis 'dul ba'i srog chags brgyad khri dag ni /
translated: Eighty thousand beings who were to be trained by the śrāvakas

original: nyan thos kyi rdzu 'phrul mthong nas chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral te rnam par dag go /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rdzu 'phrul mthong nas chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral te rnam par dag go /
translated: saw the miraculous powers of the śrāvakas and, with regard to phenomena, their eyes of Dharma became free from dust and spotless.

original: lha'i bu khri dag gis ni /
analyzed: lha'i bu khri dag gis ni /
translated: Ten thousand sons of gods

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul mthong nas chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral te rnam par dag go /🔽gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i @202a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul mthong nas chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral te rnam par dag go / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i @202a *//
translated: saw the miraculous powers of the Blessed One and, with regard to phenomena, their eyes of Dharma became free from dust and spotless.

original: bu khri dag gis ni /
analyzed: bu khri dag gis ni /
translated: Ten thousand gods who lived in the form realm🔽saw the miraculous powers of the Blessed One and, with regard to phenomena, their eyes of Dharma became free from dust and spotless.

original: chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral te rnam par dag pa nas phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa'i bar du gyur to //
analyzed: chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral te rnam par dag pa nas phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa'i bar du gyur to //
translated: They attained the fruit of nonreturner.

original: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis dri za'i rgyal po'i bu gtsug phud lnga pa la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis dri za'i rgyal po'i bu gtsug phud lnga pa la smras pa /
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to Pañcaśikha, the son of the gandharva king:

original: gtsug phud lnga pa /
analyzed: gtsug phud lnga pa /
translated: “Pañcaśikha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la bkur sti gyis shig /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la bkur sti gyis shig /
translated: honor the Thus-Gone One!

original: dri za'i rgyal po'i bu gtsug phud lnga pas de ltar 'tshal zhes lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyi ltar mnyan te /
analyzed: dri za'i rgyal po'i bu gtsug phud lnga pas de ltar 'tshal zhes lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyi ltar mnyan te /
translated: The Gandharva prince Pañcaśikha said, I will do as you say, and listened to the instructions of Śakra, Lord of the Gods.

original: dri za sa ya phrag drug dang lhan cig tu rgyud kyi dbyangs dang; klu'i dbyangs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la bkur sti byed do //
analyzed: dri za sa ya phrag drug dang lhan cig tu rgyud kyi dbyangs dang; klu'i dbyangs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la bkur sti byed do //
translated: Together with six million Gandharvas, he paid homage to the Tathāgata with the melodies of the scriptures and the songs of the nāgas.

original: rol mo'i sgra dang / glu sgra de dag gis rgya mtsho chen po'i klu'i rgyal po dag rab tu dga' zhing bde ba dang yid bde ba skyes nas rang rang gi gnas nas byung ngo //
analyzed: rol mo'i sgra dang / glu sgra de dag gis rgya mtsho chen po'i klu'i rgyal po dag rab tu dga' zhing bde ba dang yid bde ba skyes nas rang rang gi gnas nas byung ngo //
translated: Those sounds of music and song delighted the nāga kings of the great ocean, bringing them joy and mental satisfaction, and they emerged from their abodes.

original: de dag byung bas rgya mtsho chen po na 'byung po chen po dag gi gnas rnam par 'khrugs so //
analyzed: de dag byung bas rgya mtsho chen po na 'byung po chen po dag gi gnas rnam par 'khrugs so //
translated: As they emerged, the abodes of the great beings in the great ocean were disturbed.

original: klu'i rgyal po mdzes pa la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag brgya dag bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir rgya mtsho chen po nas bskyod do //
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po mdzes pa la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag brgya dag bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir rgya mtsho chen po nas bskyod do //
translated: The nāga kings such as Sundara, a hundred million nāgas, stirred from the great ocean to see the Blessed One.

original: klu'i rgyal po lha mdzes la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dag bcom ldan 'das blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir bskyod do //
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po lha mdzes la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dag bcom ldan 'das blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir bskyod do //
translated: The nāga kings Sundara and others, nine hundred million nāgas, set out to see the Blessed One, to pay homage to him, and to honor him.

original: klu'i rgyal po rgya mtsho la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu @202b dag bcom ldan 'das blta ba'i phyir rgya mtsho chen po nas bskyod do //
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po rgya mtsho la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu @202b dag bcom ldan 'das blta ba'i phyir rgya mtsho chen po nas bskyod do //
translated: The nāga kings Sāgara and others, nine hundred million nāgas, set out from the great ocean to see the Blessed One.

original: klu'i rgyal po gser gtsug la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dag bcom ldan 'das blta ba'i phyir bskyod do; ;klu'i rgyal po autpal mig la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dag bcom ldan 'das blta ba'i phyir bskyod do //🔽klu'i rgyal po dga' bo la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu nas de bzhin du sbyar te thams cad la'ang bya'o //

translated: The nāga kings Suvarṇacūḍa and others, nine hundred million nāgas, set out to see the Blessed One. The nāga kings Utpalanetra and others, nine hundred million nāgas, set out to see the Blessed One.🔽The nāga kings Nanda and others, nine hundred million nāgas, and so on, all of them, set out to see the Blessed One.

original: klu'i rgyal po nye dga' la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang / klu'i rgyal po ma dros pa la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang / klu'i rgyal po ae la'i r'a ba na la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po nye dga' la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang / klu'i rgyal po ma dros pa la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang / klu'i rgyal po ae la'i r'a ba na la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang /
translated: 900 million nāgas, such as the nāga king Upakośa,🔽900 million nāgas, such as the nāga king Anavatapta,🔽900 million nāgas, such as the nāga king Elapattra,🔽900 million nāgas, such as the nāga king Vāsuki,
