analyzed: klu'i rgyal po chab pa'i bu la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang / klu'i rgyal po mi nag pa la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang / klu'i rgyal po goo ta ma la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang / klu'i rgyal po kam pa la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang /
translated: 900 million nāgas, such as the nāga king Kālaka,🔽900 million nāgas, such as the nāga king Gautama,🔽900 million nāgas, such as the nāga king Kambala,

original: klu'i rgyal po yul 'khor srung la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang / klu'i rgyal po mgrin sngon la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang / klu'i rgyal po gser mgrin la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang / klu'i rgyal po 'jigs sgrol la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po yul 'khor srung la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang / klu'i rgyal po mgrin sngon la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang / klu'i rgyal po gser mgrin la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang / klu'i rgyal po 'jigs sgrol la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang /
translated: 900 million nāgas, such as the nāga king Bhīmasena,

original: klu'i rgyal po gzi can la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu @203a *//
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po gzi can la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu @203a *//
translated: 900 million nāgas, such as the nāga king Tejasvat,🔽900 million nāgas, such as the nāga king Vairocana,

original: dang / klu'i rgyal po rnam par snang byed la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang / klu'i rgyal po rdul bral la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: dang / klu'i rgyal po rnam par snang byed la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang / klu'i rgyal po rdul bral la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: 900 million nāgas, such as the nāga king Viraja, and so on.

original: klu'i rgyal po 'od chen la sogs pa dang / klu'i rgyal po rab tu gdung byed la sogs pa dang / klu'i rgyal po stobs chen la sogs pa dang / klu'i rgyal po sprin chen la sogs pa dang / klu'i rgyal po zla chen la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po 'od chen la sogs pa dang / klu'i rgyal po rab tu gdung byed la sogs pa dang / klu'i rgyal po stobs chen la sogs pa dang / klu'i rgyal po sprin chen la sogs pa dang / klu'i rgyal po zla chen la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang /
translated: the nāga king Great Light and so forth, the nāga king Great Torment and so forth, the nāga king Great Strength and so forth, the nāga king Great Cloud and so forth, the nāga king Great Moon and so forth, nine hundred million nāgas,

original: rlung yang dag par ston pa la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang; klu'i rgyal po shugs 'dzin la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang / klu'i rgyal po sprin chen la sogs pa dang / klu'i rgyal po rab tu gdul dka' la sogs pa dang; klu'i rgyal po thams cad me long zhes bya ba klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang /
analyzed: rlung yang dag par ston pa la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang; klu'i rgyal po shugs 'dzin la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang / klu'i rgyal po sprin chen la sogs pa dang / klu'i rgyal po rab tu gdul dka' la sogs pa dang; klu'i rgyal po thams cad me long zhes bya ba klu dung phyur phrag dgu dang /
translated: the nāga king Correctly Displaying Wind and so forth, nine hundred million nāgas, the nāga king Strength Holder and so forth, nine hundred million nāgas, the nāga king Great Cloud and so forth, the nāga king Very Difficult to Tame and so forth, the nāga king called Mirror of All and nine hundred million nāgas,

original: klu'i rgyal po char chen spyod la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dag bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir rgya mtsho chen po nas bskyod do //
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po char chen spyod la sogs pa klu dung phyur phrag dgu dag bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir rgya mtsho chen po nas bskyod do //
translated: the nāga king Great Cloud Conduct and so forth, nine hundred million nāgas, all of whom rose up from the great ocean in order to see the Bhagavān.

original: de dag la sogs pa klu bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dpag tu med pa gzhan dag dang / 'khor dung phyur phrag dgu dag bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir rgya mtsho chen po nas bskyod do //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa klu bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dpag tu med pa gzhan dag dang / 'khor dung phyur phrag dgu dag bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir rgya mtsho chen po nas bskyod do //
translated: and so on, with other countless hundreds of thousands of quintillions of nāgas, and with a retinue of nine hundred million, rose up from the great ocean in order to see the Bhagavān.

original: de dag gis rgya mtsho chen po dkrugs so //
analyzed: de dag gis rgya mtsho chen po dkrugs so //
translated: They churned up the great ocean.

original: dge slong de dag gis kyang grong khyer dang / @203b grong rdal dang / tshong dus dang / ri 'or sa dang bcas pa dkrugs so //
analyzed: dge slong de dag gis kyang grong khyer dang / @203b grong rdal dang / tshong dus dang / ri 'or sa dang bcas pa dkrugs so //
translated: Those bhikṣus churned up the towns, cities, markets, and villages, and the land.

original: de nas sa rnam pa du mar g-yos /🔽rab tu g-yos /
analyzed: de nas sa rnam pa du mar g-yos / rab tu g-yos /
translated: Then the earth shook in many ways.🔽It shook greatly.

original: kun tu rab tu g-yos /
analyzed: kun tu rab tu g-yos /
translated: It shook everywhere greatly.🔽It trembled.

original: 'gul / rab tu 'gul /
analyzed: 'gul / rab tu 'gul /
translated: It trembled greatly.

original: kun tu rab tu 'gul //
analyzed: kun tu rab tu 'gul //
translated: It trembled everywhere greatly.🔽It quivered.

original: ldeg / rab tu ldeg /
analyzed: ldeg / rab tu ldeg /
translated: It quivered greatly.

original: kun tu rab tu ldeg go /
analyzed: kun tu rab tu ldeg go /
translated: It quivered everywhere greatly.

original: de nas khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun la bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / myang ba bzang zhing rab tu mang po rang gi lag gis yang dag par tshim par byas shing yang dag par brims so //
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag phyva mkhan gyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun la bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / myang ba bzang zhing rab tu mang po rang gi lag gis yang dag par tshim par byas shing yang dag par brims so //
translated: you should not eat the alms of anyone.🔽This great city of Sugatacīraṇyagarbha may be destroyed by the nāgas.🔽Then the Blessed One, having accepted the alms, rose up into the sky

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa; dge slong dag /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa; dge slong dag /
translated: and said to the monks, “Monks,🔽 Translation: Then the householder carpenter satisfied and served with his own hands the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks with good, abundant food, drink, and snacks.🔽Then the Blessed One said to the monks, “Monks,

original: su'i bsod snyoms kyang yongs su bza' bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: su'i bsod snyoms kyang yongs su bza' bar mi bya ste /
translated: you should not eat the alms of anyone.

original: grong khyer chen po dge ba'i pha rol 'gro ba 'di klu dkrugs pa dag gis grong khyer ma rung par byas sa re /
analyzed: grong khyer chen po dge ba'i pha rol 'gro ba 'di klu dkrugs pa dag gis grong khyer ma rung par byas sa re /
translated: This great city of Sugatacīraṇyagarbha may be destroyed by the nāgas.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das bsod snyoms bzhes nas nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das bsod snyoms bzhes nas nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having accepted the alms, rose up into the sky

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / ngang pa'i rgyal po chen po bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / ngang pa'i rgyal po chen po bzhin no //
translated: and said to the monks, “Monks,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi dge 'dun phyir bkye nas gnas su sprul pa brgya stong phrag dpag tu med pa dag mngon par sprul to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi dge 'dun phyir bkye nas gnas su sprul pa brgya stong phrag dpag tu med pa dag mngon par sprul to //
translated: Then the Blessed One dismissed the community of monks and manifested countless hundreds of thousands of emanations in the abode.

original: der klu'i rgyal po gang dag bcom ldan 'das blta bar 'dod pa de dag la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa mngon par sprul to //🔽klu'i rgyal po gang dag bcom ldan 'das la ma dad cing blta bar @204a *//
analyzed: der klu'i rgyal po gang dag bcom ldan 'das blta bar 'dod pa de dag la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa mngon par sprul to // klu'i rgyal po gang dag bcom ldan 'das la ma dad cing blta bar @204a *//
translated: To those nāga kings who wished to see the Blessed One, he manifested emanations of the Tathāgata.

original: mi 'dod pa de dag yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du 'od zer bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag dpag tu med pa dag mngon par sprul to //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa de dag yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du 'od zer bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag dpag tu med pa dag mngon par sprul to //
translated: To those nāga kings who had no faith in the Blessed One and did not wish to see him, he manifested countless hundreds of thousands of millions of light rays in order to ripen them.

original: der klu bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag dpag tu med pa dag mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob bo //
analyzed: der klu bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag dpag tu med pa dag mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob bo //
translated: There, countless hundreds of thousands of millions of nāgas attained acceptance of the non-arising of phenomena.

original: klu bye ba khrag khrig dpag tu med pa dag ni /
analyzed: klu bye ba khrag khrig dpag tu med pa dag ni /
translated: Countless hundreds of thousands of millions of nāgas

original: sangs rgyas la dad pa skyes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la dad pa skyes so //
translated: gave rise to faith in the Buddha.

original: de dag dad pa thob ma thag tu klu'i skye gnas de nas shi ste bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du skyes so //
analyzed: de dag dad pa thob ma thag tu klu'i skye gnas de nas shi ste bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du skyes so //
translated: As soon as they had gained faith, they died and were reborn in the heavens.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis klu bye ba khrag khrig dpag tu med pa de dag btul nas bsod snyoms bzhes te bar snang la gshegs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis klu bye ba khrag khrig dpag tu med pa de dag btul nas bsod snyoms bzhes te bar snang la gshegs so //
translated: Then the Bhagavān, having tamed those countless quintillions of nāgas, accepted the alms and departed into the sky.

original: de'i tshe na yul lag mthil ltar mnyam pa na dka' thub can mes byin zhes bya ba zhig gnas te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na yul lag mthil ltar mnyam pa na dka' thub can mes byin zhes bya ba zhig gnas te /
translated: At that time, in the land of Karotapāṇi, there was an ascetic named Agnidatta.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das nam mkha'i bar snang las gshegs pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das nam mkha'i bar snang las gshegs pa mthong ngo //
translated: He saw the Bhagavān traveling through the sky.

original: de mthong nas kyang bcom ldan 'das la shin tu gus pa bskyed nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de mthong nas kyang bcom ldan 'das la shin tu gus pa bskyed nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When he saw this, he developed great respect for the Bhagavān and said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: bdag la mtshan ma'i rnam pa de bzhin du mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: bdag la mtshan ma'i rnam pa de bzhin du mdzad du gsol /
translated: please leave a sign of your presence here.

original: gang bdag gi gnas 'dir bzhugs na /
analyzed: gang bdag gi gnas 'dir bzhugs na /
translated: If you remain in this place of mine,

original: mchod par bgyi'o //
analyzed: mchod par bgyi'o //
translated: I will make offerings to you.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ral pa can mes byin gyi bsam pa thugs su chud nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ral pa can mes byin gyi bsam pa thugs su chud nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, understanding the thoughts of the matted-hair ascetic Anāthapiṇḍada,

original: skye bo phyi ma dag nyid la @204b thugs brtse ba'i slad du rdo leb la zhabs bzhag go /
analyzed: skye bo phyi ma dag nyid la @204b thugs brtse ba'i slad du rdo leb la zhabs bzhag go /
translated: placed his foot on a flat stone out of compassion for future generations.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi ral pa can mes byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi ral pa can mes byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said this to the matted-hair ascetic Anāthapiṇḍada:

original: bram ze / khyod kyi sems dad par bya ba'i don du 'di ni /
analyzed: bram ze / khyod kyi sems dad par bya ba'i don du 'di ni /
translated: Brahmin, for the sake of purifying your mind, this

original: mchod rten no //
analyzed: mchod rten no //
translated: is a stūpa.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana:

original: moonggal gyi bu tshur shog /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu tshur shog /
translated: Come, Maudgalyāyana,

original: ma dros pa'i mtsho ga la ba der 'dong ngo //
analyzed: ma dros pa'i mtsho ga la ba der 'dong ngo //
translated: let us go to the lake Anavatapta.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,🔽excellent!

original: legs so // zhes gsol nas tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar mnyan nas klu'i rgyal po ma dros pa'i gnas kyi chu 'gram du bzhugs so //
analyzed: legs so // zhes gsol nas tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar mnyan nas klu'i rgyal po ma dros pa'i gnas kyi chu 'gram du bzhugs so //
translated: The venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, having listened to the Blessed One, stayed on the bank of the lake of the nāga king Anavatapta.

original: de nas klu'i rgyal po ma dros pa bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa gshegs par rig nas gser dang / dngul dang / bee d'urya dang / shel dang / mu tig dmar po dang / spug gi snying po dang / rdo'i snying po rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i stan lnga brgya tsam zhig mngon par sprul to //
analyzed: de nas klu'i rgyal po ma dros pa bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa gshegs par rig nas gser dang / dngul dang / bee d'urya dang / shel dang / mu tig dmar po dang / spug gi snying po dang / rdo'i snying po rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i stan lnga brgya tsam zhig mngon par sprul to //
translated: Then, the nāga king Anavatapta, knowing that the Blessed One had arrived with the saṅgha of hearers, manifested about five hundred seats made of the seven precious substances: gold, silver, beryl, crystal, red pearl, coral, and stone.

original: khri stan lnga brgya de dag gi dbus su bcom ldan 'das kyi gdan rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i gdan bshams te klu'i ras bcos bus g-yogs so //
analyzed: khri stan lnga brgya de dag gi dbus su bcom ldan 'das kyi gdan rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i gdan bshams te klu'i ras bcos bus g-yogs so //
translated: In the center of those five hundred thrones, he arranged a seat for the Blessed One made of the seven precious substances, covered with a nāga girl's cloth.

original: de nas klu'i rgyal po ma dros pa klu'i bu mo 'khor dang bcas pa bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du song ngo //
analyzed: de nas klu'i rgyal po ma dros pa klu'i bu mo 'khor dang bcas pa bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du song ngo //
translated: Then, the nāga king Anavatapta, together with his retinue of nāga girls, went into the presence of the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po zan zos shing lhung bzed @205a *//
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po zan zos shing lhung bzed @205a *//
translated: Then, the Blessed One said to the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, Maudgalyāyana, eat your meal and put away your bowl and robe.

original: dang lag pa bkrus par thugs su chud nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dang lag pa bkrus par thugs su chud nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One understood that they had washed their hands and said,

original: moonggal gyi bu /🔽song la gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu khyod la ston pa 'bod do //
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu / song la gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu khyod la ston pa 'bod do //
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: zhes smros shig /🔽bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: zhes smros shig / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: go and tell the elder Śāriputra that the Teacher is calling him.”

original: legs so // zhes gsol te /
analyzed: legs so // zhes gsol te /
translated: “Very well, Blessed One,” he replied.

original: tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar mnyan nas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar mnyan nas 'di lta ste /
translated: The venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana, having listened to the Blessed One,

original: dper na / skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa'i lag pa bskum pa brkyang ba'am /
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa'i lag pa bskum pa brkyang ba'am /
translated: just as a strong man might extend his flexed arm or flex his extended arm,

original: brkyang ba bskum pa de bzhin du tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po ma dros pa'i mtshon nas byung ste rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i mdun na 'dug go /
analyzed: brkyang ba bskum pa de bzhin du tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po ma dros pa'i mtshon nas byung ste rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i mdun na 'dug go /
translated: disappeared from Lake Anavatapta and appeared in front of the venerable Śāriputra in the garden of Prince Jeta.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu snam sbyar 'drub par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu snam sbyar 'drub par gyur to //
translated: At that time, the venerable Śāriputra was sewing a patchwork robe.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang lhan cig tu yang dag par dga' ba'i gtam dang / gtam snyan pa rnam pa mang po byas nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang lhan cig tu yang dag par dga' ba'i gtam dang / gtam snyan pa rnam pa mang po byas nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana, having had many kinds of pleasant and delightful conversations with the venerable Śāriputra, said to him:

original: ston pa ni /
analyzed: ston pa ni /
translated: “Teacher,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu khyod la 'bod de /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu khyod la 'bod de /
translated: the venerable Śāriputra is calling you.

original: ston pa khyod la mngon par dgyes kyi /
analyzed: ston pa khyod la mngon par dgyes kyi /
translated: The Teacher is pleased with you.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu tshur shog /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu tshur shog /
translated: Come, venerable Śāriputra!

original: ston pa khyod la gsung gi 'dod ngo //
analyzed: ston pa khyod la gsung gi 'dod ngo //
translated: The Teacher wishes to speak with you.”

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this was said, the venerable Śāriputra said to the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana,

original: tshe dang ldan moonggal gyi bu @205b chen po;/
analyzed: tshe dang ldan moonggal gyi bu @205b chen po;/
translated: “Venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana,

original: re zhig snam sbyar 'di 'tshem mo //
analyzed: re zhig snam sbyar 'di 'tshem mo //
translated: I am sewing this outer robe.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen pos sor mo lnga kha ba lngar mngon par sprul nas snam sbyar de btsems so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen pos sor mo lnga kha ba lngar mngon par sprul nas snam sbyar de btsems so //
translated: Then the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana manifested five fingers as five snow mountains and sewed the robe.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana,

original: tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana,

original: 'di ci byed /
analyzed: 'di ci byed /
translated: what are you doing?”

original: smras pa / snam sbyar btsem par bya ba 'di myur du btsem par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / snam sbyar btsem par bya ba 'di myur du btsem par bya'o //
translated: He replied, “I am quickly sewing this robe that is to be sewn.”

original: smras pa / drub pa dang // zin pa nyid du gyis shig /
analyzed: smras pa / drub pa dang // zin pa nyid du gyis shig /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Make it so that it is both woven and finished.”

original: de ma thag tu drub cing zin pa nyid du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: de ma thag tu drub cing zin pa nyid du byas nas smras pa /
translated: As soon as he said that, it was both woven and finished. He said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: tshur shog da 'dong /
analyzed: tshur shog da 'dong /
translated: come, let us go.”

original: smras pa / mi 'gro /
analyzed: smras pa / mi 'gro /
translated: Śāriputra said, “I will not go.”

original: smras pa / gal te khyod mi 'gro na /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te khyod mi 'gro na /
translated: Mahā­maudgalyāyana said, “If you will not go,

original: stobs kyis bkur ro //
analyzed: stobs kyis bkur ro //
translated: I will carry you by force.”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana,

original: re zhig ska rags 'di stobs kyis khyer nus dang nga stobs kyis khyer bar shes so //
analyzed: re zhig ska rags 'di stobs kyis khyer nus dang nga stobs kyis khyer bar shes so //
translated: I will know who is stronger, you or I.

original: des ska rags de 'jig rten gyi khams bdun du byin gyis brlabs so //
analyzed: des ska rags de 'jig rten gyi khams bdun du byin gyis brlabs so //
translated: He blessed the belt to weigh seven world-realms.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen pos ska rags de rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis bteg pa na stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di g-yos kyang ska rags de gdeg par ma nus so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen pos ska rags de rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis bteg pa na stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di g-yos kyang ska rags de gdeg par ma nus so //
translated: Then the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, with his magical power, lifted the belt, and the great trichiliocosm shook, but he was unable to lift the belt.

original: de nas ma dros pa'i mtsho rlabs shin tu g-yos so //
analyzed: de nas ma dros pa'i mtsho rlabs shin tu g-yos so //
translated: Then the waves of the Anavatapta Lake were greatly disturbed.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Aśvajit asked the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽'jig rten du dog sa chen po g-yos pa @206a *//🔽byung ba 'di rgyu gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / 'jig rten du dog sa chen po g-yos pa @206a *// byung ba 'di rgyu gang lags /
translated: Blessed One,🔽what is the cause🔽and what is the condition

original: rkyen gang lags /
analyzed: rkyen gang lags /
translated: for this great earthquake in the world?🔽When he said this, the Blessed One said to Aśvajit,

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis rta thul la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis rta thul la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Aśvajit,

original: nyan thos chen po'i rnam par 'phrul pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos chen po'i rnam par 'phrul pa'o //
translated: This is the manifestation of a great śrāvaka.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the venerable Maudgalyāyana,

original: tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Venerable Maudgalyāyana,

original: je bzhud cig /
analyzed: je bzhud cig /
translated: let us go.

original: bdag kyang mchi'o //
analyzed: bdag kyang mchi'o //
translated: I too will go.”

original: de skad smras nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar song nas zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: de skad smras nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar song nas zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: Having said this, the venerable Śāriputra went into the presence of the Blessed One, bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet, and sat to one side.

original: tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po ni /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po ni /
translated: The venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana

original: phyi nas 'ong ngo //
analyzed: phyi nas 'ong ngo //
translated: came later.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu mngon du phyogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul thob pas de dang por bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar song nas 'dug go /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu mngon du phyogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul thob pas de dang por bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar song nas 'dug go /
translated: The venerable Śāriputra, having attained the supernormal power of direct perception, went first into the presence of the Blessed One and sat down.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan ma de lta bu byung ba mdzad pa'i mtshan ma ji lta bu byung ba mdzad pas rgya mtsho'i klu'i rgyal po bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan ma de lta bu byung ba mdzad pa'i mtshan ma ji lta bu byung ba mdzad pas rgya mtsho'i klu'i rgyal po bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: Then the Blessed One manifested such a sign, and the ocean nāga king, seeing such a sign, went to where the Blessed One was and sat to one side.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la klu'i rgyal po mdzes dags 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la klu'i rgyal po mdzes dags 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the nāga king Sundara said this to the Blessed One:

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la skabs phye na /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la skabs phye na /
translated: “If the Blessed One would grant me an opportunity,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag phyogs 'ga' zhig zhu'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag phyogs 'ga' zhig zhu'o //
translated: I would like to ask the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, about a few points.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied:

original: mdzes dga'/ ngas zhu ba lung bstan @206b pa'i phyir 'di ltar thams cad skabs dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: mdzes dga'/ ngas zhu ba lung bstan @206b pa'i phyir 'di ltar thams cad skabs dbye bar bya'o //
translated: “Sundara, I will grant an opportunity for questioning in order to explain the answers.

original: tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: In verse it is said:

original: ston pa bde sbyin mdzad la zhu ba ni //
analyzed: ston pa bde sbyin mdzad la zhu ba ni //
translated: I ask the Teacher, the one who bestows happiness,🔽What karma was done while practicing,

original: spyad pa spyod tshe sug las ci bgyis dang // bde ba'i lam gyis mya ngan 'das reg pa //
analyzed: spyad pa spyod tshe sug las ci bgyis dang // bde ba'i lam gyis mya ngan 'das reg pa //
translated: And by what path of happiness did you reach nirvāṇa?

original: bde gshegs sbyin mdzad de ni lung bstan gsol //
analyzed: bde gshegs sbyin mdzad de ni lung bstan gsol //
translated: Sugata, please explain that giving.”

original: ma dros klu yi 'jig rten mgon de la //🔽zhus pa bde bar gshegs pas lung bstan pa //
analyzed: ma dros klu yi 'jig rten mgon de la // zhus pa bde bar gshegs pas lung bstan pa //
translated: that the protector of the world, the nāga Anavatapta,

original: dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bus yid zhi zhing //
analyzed: dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bus yid zhi zhing //
translated: will have a peaceful mind through the results of virtuous actions

original: gang gi bde bas bde bar gshegs pa bskyed //
analyzed: gang gi bde bas bde bar gshegs pa bskyed //
translated: and will be born as a sugata through his happiness.

original: sngon gyi srid par spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe //
analyzed: sngon gyi srid par spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe //
translated: “When he was practicing bodhisattva conduct in previous existences,

original: skye bo thams cad bde bas bde ldan byas //
analyzed: skye bo thams cad bde bas bde ldan byas //
translated: he made all beings happy through happiness.

original: de yis legs pa'i las de byas pas na //
analyzed: de yis legs pa'i las de byas pas na //
translated: Because of the virtuous actions he performed,

original: bde ba'i lam gyis mya ngan 'das reg 'gyur //
analyzed: bde ba'i lam gyis mya ngan 'das reg 'gyur //
translated: he will reach nirvāṇa through the path of happiness.

original: ston pa'i gsung gis mdzes pa de dga' nas //
analyzed: ston pa'i gsung gis mdzes pa de dga' nas //
translated: “The one who is beautiful through the Teacher’s speech,

original: de yi skad cig sa steng pus btsugs te //
analyzed: de yi skad cig sa steng pus btsugs te //
translated: in that very instant, on the earth, kneeling on his right knee,

original: gzhal med dga' yis sems ni dang bas su //
analyzed: gzhal med dga' yis sems ni dang bas su //
translated: with a mind of faith and joy,

original: 'jig rten sgron ma 'dren la phyag 'tshal byed //
analyzed: 'jig rten sgron ma 'dren la phyag 'tshal byed //
translated: pays homage to the light of the world, the guide.

original: ston pa'i blo yis mkhas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: ston pa'i blo yis mkhas la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: “Homage to the one who is wise through the Teacher’s mind,

original: 'gro ba kun las nges 'byung phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun las nges 'byung phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: homage to the one who has definitely left the entire world,

original: 'jigs med blo dag pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jigs med blo dag pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: homage to the one with a pure, fearless mind,

original: bde gshegs gzhan min gsung la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bde gshegs gzhan min gsung la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: homage to the one whose speech, Sugata, is not different.

original: de nas klu'i rgyal po lha mdzes kyis bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis zhus pa //
analyzed: de nas klu'i rgyal po lha mdzes kyis bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis zhus pa //
translated: Then the naga king Sundara addressed the Bhagavat in verse:

original: 'od mdzad spyan sdug legs pa'i spyan mnga' ba //
analyzed: 'od mdzad spyan sdug legs pa'i spyan mnga' ba //
translated: “You who are radiant, with beautiful eyes,

original: blo dge nyon mongs tshogs las rnam grol zhing //
analyzed: blo dge nyon mongs tshogs las rnam grol zhing //
translated: Your mind is virtuous, and you are free from the mass of afflictions.

original: ye shes dri med spyod yul khyod la ni /
analyzed: ye shes dri med spyod yul khyod la ni /
translated: You who are stainless and have wisdom,🔽I ask you about the unsurpassed liberation

original: @207a *// spyad pa spyod tshe rnam thar bla med zhu //
analyzed: @207a *// spyad pa spyod tshe rnam thar bla med zhu //
translated: While practicing the conduct.

original: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten sman slad du //
analyzed: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten sman slad du //
translated: For the sake of the world, including the gods,

original: ji ltar spyad na byang chub zhi 'tshal zhing //
analyzed: ji ltar spyad na byang chub zhi 'tshal zhing //
translated: How should I practice to attain the peace of enlightenment?

original: mi mchog dam pa bdag gi spyod spyod pa //
analyzed: mi mchog dam pa bdag gi spyod spyod pa //
translated: I, the supreme human, will practice that conduct.

original: yid 'das de dag bdag la bka' stsal gsol //
analyzed: yid 'das de dag bdag la bka' stsal gsol //
translated: Please tell me those things that transcend the mind.

original: rgyal ba de yis rdul bcom dbang po bsdams //
analyzed: rgyal ba de yis rdul bcom dbang po bsdams //
translated: The Victorious One, who has subdued the dust and restrained the senses,🔽Whose mind is liberated from the bonds of desire,

original: 'dod pa'i 'ching las thugs ni rnam grol ba'i; ;dgongs pa'i de nyid sems kyi rjes 'jug pa //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'ching las thugs ni rnam grol ba'i; ;dgongs pa'i de nyid sems kyi rjes 'jug pa //
translated: The one whose intention follows the mind,

original: thugs zhim dkrugs des ni lung bstan pa //
analyzed: thugs zhim dkrugs des ni lung bstan pa //
translated: With that gentle mind, he gave the prophecy:

original: mkhas pas dge ba dag ni spyad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mkhas pas dge ba dag ni spyad pa'i phyir //
translated: “For the wise ones to practice virtue,

original: srog gi phyir yang yid ni mi ldog cing; ;rtag tu spyod tshe nyon mongs med yid kyis //
analyzed: srog gi phyir yang yid ni mi ldog cing; ;rtag tu spyod tshe nyon mongs med yid kyis //
translated: “Even at the cost of their lives, they never turn back, And with a mind free of afflictions, they always practice.

original: lus dang dag gi dge ba mnyam spyod pa //
analyzed: lus dang dag gi dge ba mnyam spyod pa //
translated: They practice equally with body and speech.

original: de yis legs pa'i las de byas pas na //
analyzed: de yis legs pa'i las de byas pas na //
translated: “Because they have done these good actions,

original: 'khor ba'i 'gro la spyod pa rnam dag ste; ;chu yi nang nas padma skye ba ltag /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'gro la spyod pa rnam dag ste; ;chu yi nang nas padma skye ba ltag /
translated: They are pure in their conduct in saṃsāra, Like a lotus growing out of the water.

original: gos pa med cing byang chub yang dag 'grub //
analyzed: gos pa med cing byang chub yang dag 'grub //
translated: They are unstained and accomplish enlightenment.

original: bde gshegs gsung gis lha yi mdzes pa klu //
analyzed: bde gshegs gsung gis lha yi mdzes pa klu //
translated: “The Sugata’s speech delights the gods and nāgas.

original: de ni dga' zhing legs par mgu bas su; ;de yi skad cig sa la pus btsugs te //
analyzed: de ni dga' zhing legs par mgu bas su; ;de yi skad cig sa la pus btsugs te //
translated: They are happy and pleased, and in that instant they kneel on the ground

original: sangs rgyas rkang gnyis mchog la phyag 'tshal byed //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rkang gnyis mchog la phyag 'tshal byed //
translated: And pay homage to the Buddha, the best of humans.

original: thub pa 'jig rten kun la sman mdzad pa //
analyzed: thub pa 'jig rten kun la sman mdzad pa //
translated: “The Sage, who benefits the whole world,

original: blo gros nges par zhi la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: blo gros nges par zhi la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the one with definite peace of mind!

original: spyad pa spyod tshe khyod kyi rjes slob cing //
analyzed: spyad pa spyod tshe khyod kyi rjes slob cing //
translated: While practicing bodhisattva conduct,

original: byang chub mi g-yo yid ni bskyed par bgyi //
analyzed: byang chub mi g-yo yid ni bskyed par bgyi //
translated: We will arouse the unshakable mind of awakening.

original: sems can don du spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe //
analyzed: sems can don du spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe //
translated: “While practicing bodhisattva conduct for the sake of sentient beings,

original: lus dang srog ni de bzhin @207b btang nas su //
analyzed: lus dang srog ni de bzhin @207b btang nas su //
translated: And I will give up my body and life.🔽I will become a buddha who liberates from suffering,

original: sdug bsngal thar byed sangs rgyas 'gyur ba dang // byang chub zhi pa bla med thob pa'i bgyi //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thar byed sangs rgyas 'gyur ba dang // byang chub zhi pa bla med thob pa'i bgyi //
translated: And I will attain the unsurpassed peace of enlightenment.

original: klu de'i bsam pa thugs su chud nas su //
analyzed: klu de'i bsam pa thugs su chud nas su //
translated: Understanding the nāga’s intention,

original: rgyal ba dgra las rgyal ba 'dzum mdzad de //🔽de tshe ji ltar gangg'a'i bye snyed kyi //
analyzed: rgyal ba dgra las rgyal ba 'dzum mdzad de // de tshe ji ltar gangg'a'i bye snyed kyi //
translated: The Victorious One, the Conqueror, smiled.🔽At that time, as many buddhafields as there are

original: sangs rgyas mtha' yas zhing ni 'od kyis khyab //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mtha' yas zhing ni 'od kyis khyab //
translated: Sands in the Ganges were filled with light.

original: bde bar gshegs pas 'dzum pa bstan pa la //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas 'dzum pa bstan pa la //
translated: When the Sugata revealed his smile,

original: nam mkha'i lhas rig legs so zhes gsol te //
analyzed: nam mkha'i lhas rig legs so zhes gsol te //
translated: The gods in the sky said, “Excellent!”

original: ae ma'o rgyal bas rdul bcom dbang po bsgoms //
analyzed: ae ma'o rgyal bas rdul bcom dbang po bsgoms //
translated: “Ah! The Victor, the one who has conquered the defilements, has contemplated the senses.

original: khyod dang mnyam med gong na yong ma yin //
analyzed: khyod dang mnyam med gong na yong ma yin //
translated: There is no one equal to you, let alone a superior one.

original: sangs rgyas zhing mang dag ni rab g-yo sa shing //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhing mang dag ni rab g-yo sa shing //
translated: Many buddhafields trembled,

original: 'dod pa'i lha ni sder bcas shin tu rmongs //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i lha ni sder bcas shin tu rmongs //
translated: And the desire gods, together with their retinues, were greatly confused.

original: lha tshogs mang po bsam pa rab dga' zhing //
analyzed: lha tshogs mang po bsam pa rab dga' zhing //
translated: The many hosts of gods were delighted in their intentions

original: rgyal ba dbang po thub la phyag 'tshal byed //
analyzed: rgyal ba dbang po thub la phyag 'tshal byed //
translated: And they bowed to the Victorious One, the Sage, the Lord.

original: ston pa'i nyan thos rdzu 'phrul che ba'i mchog moonggal bu yis rgyal la yongs zhus pa //
analyzed: ston pa'i nyan thos rdzu 'phrul che ba'i mchog moonggal bu yis rgyal la yongs zhus pa //
translated: The Buddha’s foremost disciple in miraculous powers, Maudgalyāyana, was asked by King Prasenajit:
